results.description:
Convenience is King! We are experiencing a revolution enabled by new technologies and shifting consumer habits, spurring what we call "The On-Demand Economy." Mobile spending will represent the fastest and largest spend shift we have seen in history, and smartphones are quickly becoming the remote controls that allow us to navigate our daily lives. 

Together, lets discover, evaluate, and recognize the innovative new commerce companies that are helping to make our lives easier and more efficient!
results.name: The On-Demand Economy

results.description:
Like us on Facebook! 

You've done your homework. Your instrument is at its peak. You know the part, the lines, the emotion and the motivation. But do you feel you are you worthy of the part? Of course you are, however sometimes you might show up for the audition with a bit of doubt (fear? anxiety?) and telegraph that feeling to the casting director.

You wish you only thought about the best things that you offer, but you just aren't sure if you have what it takes; what they want; or even if you are worthy. Gene Hirschel, a master in the field of behavior consulting and shaping, will show you specialized techniques that break though your existing mental limitations. Gene doesn't just tell you how to effect these changes; he actually uses the most advanced behavior technologies to install new behaviors directly into your mind and body.

Gene Hirschel has been on TV, radio and taught at the School of Visual Arts as well as many top corporations. For the first time, he brings his amazing techniques to the acting community so you too can master this crucial step in stage and screen success -- and get the part!

Imagine after this seminar:

•Easily identify and connecting to the decision maker(s) at the audition

•Learning to gain a deep rapport with almost anyone!

 •Become an expert at automatically calling in confidence and using it. •Entering a room expecting the very best performance from yourself and then-- experiencing exactly that!

•Clearly picture and know in your heart that you are absolutely worthy and deserving of the part

•Learn how to "pre-charge" the room with positive outcome energy.

•Mentally re-map previous auditions in your past to create an unstoppable “audition machine”
results.name: Audition Mastery for NYC Actors - Are you audition worthy?

results.description:
We believe in fostering entrepreneurship by building communities of startup-minded people through social and business oriented events. NYC Entrepreneurs meets and hosts weekly and monthly events where entrepreneurs connect in a relaxed yet productive way. We meet for breakfast most Thursday mornings in midtown NYC and every THIRD (or fourth) THURSDAY of the month at a local restaurant/bar/pub.

We are going to be meeting for happy hour every month at Ainsworth Park - 6-8PM
111 East 18th Street @Park Ave South (ask for the meetup or Raphi Salem)

We can help you promote your company, services, generate leads and sell your products. We welcome  entrepreneurs, individual practitioners, salespeople and representatives of companies large and small. We promote businesses within the group, awareness of each others professions, and educate each other to help increase individual success. We grow our business through relationships, networking, and referrals. RSVP here: (Payment of $20.00 must be made in advance of all meetings via paypal here: http://bit.ly/1fDv0KA - or you can pay $25.00 at the door with cash or check. The $500.00 annual membership fee entitles you to exclusive membership with no competition.)

We have been around since 2000 and have generated millions of dollars in leads and closed business. We are primarily seasoned veterans but welcome young go-getters.

We are similar to many other groups in that we are a roundtable forum and everyone gets to give their :60 second pitch. But then we go deeper into your business in our "advisory" round where we dive into your business issues and act as your own personal advisory board.

We can help you:

- develop a sales plan

- develop a marketing plan

- with finances

- with HR issues

- secure speaking engagements

- become aware of other marketing and sales opportunities, trade shows and advertising mediums

- meet other key people and partners

- get more referrals!

Call Raphi Salem (917-862-8929) today to find out more or to RSVP for any of our monthly events.

Most events take place on Thursday mornings (the 2nd, 3rd and 4th Thursday of every month) at 8-9:30AM.  Then there is more networking after the meeting until 10AM.

Cost: Annual Membership is $500. This entitles you to attend all meetings without having to pay the $20 per meeting fee. (Payment must be made in advance via paypal here:http://bit.ly/1fDv0KA) or to payments {at} salemglobal.com or $25/cash at the door.)

Sponsors: We are always looking for sponsors. Would you like to sponsor our group? Thank you to Paul Berkman of AXA Advisors for helping us secure the conference room for our meetup. He is the best in the business. Come on down to meet him!

Location: AXA Advisors 1290 Avenue of the Americas, 16th Floor

(You must RSVP in order to get on the security list)

We look forward to seeing you at our next Breakfast or other Networking event.

We are part of 5 other meetup groups. Please check them out and join: 
http://www.meetup.com/NYC-Serious-Entrepreneurs-Only-Present-Get-Funded/ 
http://www.meetup.com/Entrepreneurs-NYC-Finance-Tech-Mktg-Sales-Expert-Advice/

We are also part of linked in. Please connect with me and join our groups: 
https://www.linkedin.com/in/websitemarketing 
https://www.linkedin.com/grp/home?gid=2142515 
https://www.linkedin.com/grp/home?gid=2792115 

If you have any questions, please let me know. Thanks!

Raphi Salem
SalemGlobal Internet, Website Marketing & Lead Generation

results.description: This is a group for anyone passionate about Apple's Mac computer, technology reuse, and the burgeoning circular economy critical to our survival as a species. Planned obsolescence has never been more abundant in our society. This anti-consumer group examines the evolution of the Mac, and scrutinizes Apple's built in obsolescence strategies (how many new cables have you been forced to buy when upgrading?) You don't need to be an uber-geek to attend. All are welcome! I started this group because after nearly 20 years of working with Apple, I'm eager to share knowledge and discuss these topics. Looking forward to exploring these ideas and much more with everybody! Some group highlights: - Is Apple downgrading the Mac? - Innovative reuse and DIY - Sustainable product design
results.name: Brooklyn Immortal Tech

results.description: This is a group for entrepreneurs that want to learn the DIY way of crafting a compelling brand and website. We'll get together to learn new skills, share experiences and inspire each other. Design and Technology can be more human and approachable, this is the place where we make it humane.
results.name: Candelita

results.description:
This is a group for people who are looking for understanding (open minded) individuals to talk to. If you need to vent out and talk to someone or a group, then this is the place where you'll be heard. The members take an active role in acting as counselors and provide positive feedback and help guide members to taking steps to do better. We are all about being positive here for positive outcomes, so if your intention is to stay sad rather than progress then this is not the place for you. I started this group because when i was going through a very difficult time, i had no one to talk to, vent out or tell me that things were going to be OK. I suffered a great deal having to resolve many of these issues on my own, having to push myself out of depression was not easy. This group is made so that you don't have to go through the same thing and have someone who will listen. This group does not consist of therapist, social workers, or any type of mental health workers. just normal open minded people, willing to share their stories, listen to yours, and try our best to end things on a positive note.

You could be having a bad day or going through a rough period of time, if you need to vent out, this is a good place to try.
results.name: I need someone to talk to.

results.description:
“This is a bilingual group (English/Spanish) for anyone interested in improving their photography skills. The organizer will offer from time to time workshops in specific topics such as: The histograph, inverse square law, basic posing, depht of field, exposure triangle, flash photograhy, etc. 

This group will also meet in public places for practicing what we love, photography. When we meet, the members of the group will be given a specif task for that day. The idea here is to improve our skills step by step. The goal of the group is to learn from one another and to help each other during the shoots. 

To achieve the goal, the members of the group will be encouraged to socialize and to form small teams. Each team will have a task: One team, for example, can concentrate in depth of field and the other one can concentrate in composition. 

Each team will also have a leader. The leader will supervise and give instructions to the team on how to achieve the goal. 

 All skills levels are welcome. 

Let's make this work for us. Let's give each others a hand and at the same time learn from each other.

Tino

http://tinophotovideo.com

topics.name: Health and Wellness Information and Education

results.description:
Welcome to our new Community! 

Do you feel overwhelmed with trying to make healthy changes for you and your family?
Do you need that extra push to start eating healthy?

 If you are in need of motivation and support, join us and discover a unique approach to living your best life. We will provide you with the tools you need to make lasting changes in your life. 

I hope to be able to bring health and wellness to the forefront of people's lives.  If you are already a "health-guru" or you are just beginning your journey, this is a place to connect with people who are on that same path.  

This is about unearthing the skills you already possess and gaining the confidence to live your life to its fullest capacity. Our mantra is bio-individuality; that each person has unique food and lifestyle needs. 

Come and join us in an environment that is non-judgmental, warm and welcoming.  We will have lots of great workshops to encourage you, guide you and inspire you to integrate healthy habits into your lifestyle.  Join us as we begin our journey of transformation together!
results.name: Lifestyle Changes: A Journey of Transformation

results.description:
Join us to follow CLASSICAL4ALL events; concerts, interdisciplinary projects, music appreciation classes.

Our mission is to create new ways for presenting classical music, without altering the musical content. We believe through our interdisciplinary projects, engaging concert programs, music appreciation classes and personal approach, it is possible to break the institutionalized walls of classical music in the 21st century and reach a wider audience including those who are not familiar with the genre.

Read about Classical for All here;

"Striking a chord with the younger generation" New York Press 

http://nypress.com/striking-a-chord-with-the-younger-generation/

And here;

“By staging events in casual, inexpensive venues, they hope to appeal to listeners who may feel put off by the tradition of tuxedo-clad musicians performing in large concert halls.” Our Downtown

http://nypress.com/classical-music-cafe-style-2/

and here;

"Every Sunday afternoon, this veteran pianist plays to a crowd at Caffe Vivaldi. Beyond tickling the ivories, he shares fun facts about the music he plays and the composers who created it. On this Sunday, "Chatty Pianist" as he's known, played selections such as Mozart's Piano Sonata No. 14 in C Minor and Mendelssohn's Rondo Capriccioso.

Not a classical music connoisseur? Trust me, you don't have to be. It's nearly impossible not to be captivated by the music, let alone his charm and passion. Plus, the performance is truly spectacular, and the level you'd hear in a concert hall for a fraction of the price." Tracy's New York Life

www.tracysnewyorklife.com/2016/02/new-york-chatty-pianist-caffe-vivaldi.html

Looking forward to meeting you soon!!

Ege

www.classicalforall.com
results.name: CLASSICAL 4 ALL

results.description:
This is a group where artists can get together and we can share our work to get feedback from other artists. I am located in what is traditionally referred to as South Brooklyn (Cobble Hill, Downtown, Carroll Gardens, Red Hook, Gowanus, Park Slope, etc.  No offense to any neighborhood not listed.  More explanation can be found here: http://www.meetup.com/Brooklyn-Artists/messages/boards/thread/42818652 ) and am looking forward to meeting other artists and exchanging opinions and ideas with you. Meetings will be organized in the area, wherever it turns out appropriate for people to be able to bring their work for feedback. Ideas are welcome!

Members of the Meetup are expected to occasionally attend meetings.  I understand that we all have lives to live and people get busy, but people who sign up and never appear for a meeting with eventually be removed from the group.

<br> Personally, I am a painter with classical realist training. But artists from all media are welcome if you have something to share. Sculptors are welcome (if you can't bring it, bring pics)! Poets and musicians, come share your thoughts and work! 

One thing I ask is that members take RSVP'ing seriously.  Please let us know if you will not be coming to an event that you RSVP'ed "Yes" to. It is appreciated if you could just kindly reply "No" if you have no intention of coming to an event.  It just takes a second, and helps my planning.  Many thanks!

results.description:
Are you a journalist / blogger / photographer / critic / social media guru? 

Then you've come to the right place! 

This group isn't about "networking." It's about getting to know the community of young journalists living, working, and covering New York City. Also drinking. Media people of all stripes are welcome! 

How to use this group

• Join one of our monthly meetups, special events, or propose your own!

• Share your articles, what you're working on, get feedback

• Ask questions, get advice, talk about what's new in news

• Debate the merits of the Oxford Comma  

Who can join?

• Working journalists, freelancers, journalism students, or anyone who's interested in meeting other journalists in NYC

SPONSOR MESSAGE 
Lyft is currently offering members of our Meetup free ride credit. Visit https://www.lyft.com/invited/JOURNALISTS to get the free credit.
results.name: Journalists NYC

The TWIP - Travel With Interesting People Meetup group, is an opportunity for people to find like-minded travel partners for local, domestic, and international trips alike. We are all familiar with the difficulty in getting friends to commit to travel and aligning everyone's schedules (job responsibilities, going back to school, family/kids, etc.). This group is for those who know they want to travel, and they are looking for the who and where.

We host monthly gatherings and giveaways (from local sponsors) to connect fellow travelers, make new friends, and perhaps plan your next trip with others. We also put together local day excursions and domestic & international trips, which anyone is welcome to partake in. Our goal is to keep the enthusiasm of travel and camaraderie going strong.

results.description: This is a group for anyone who loves ragtime and traditional jazz. We'll be enjoying live music performances around New York city, particularly following a favorite ragtime piano player, Terry Waldo, a charismatic, long-time veteran of the genre. More info on Terry: Terry Waldo is considered one of America's premier performers and presenters of Ragtime and Early Jazz. Known for his virtuoso ragtime and stride piano playing, charming vocals, and disarming wit, he is the protégé‚ of the legendary Eubie Blake, who called Waldo "an extension of my own musical self." Waldo has played countless New York jazz clubs, including the legendary Cookery, Hanratty’s and Michaels’s Pub where he produced and starred in nine critically acclaimed musical revues. He has appeared in concerts worldwide, including the Grand Parade du Jazz in Venice, George Wein’s JVC Jazz Festival at Carnegie Hall and Jazz At Lincoln Center. He recently appeared with the New York Pops at Carnegie Hall where he performed the world premier of “The Eubie Blake Concerto.”

results.description:
In this meet up group we will get together for improvisation workshops in New York City Area. Classes will be open to actors and non-actors, and will focus on a genius woman's improvisation technique; the grandmother of Improvisation; Viola Spolin. According to Spolin incorporating game playing into acting training will help actors to get out of their heads and release their creative free selves. So she created "Theater Games" which became the source of the improvisational comedy as we know today through improv groups, of TV shows like Saturday Night Live.

The meet up workshops will help us experience Spolin Games and her method to achieve physical awareness, spontaneity and ensemble building.

"We learn through experience and experiencing. No one teaches anyone anything." Viola Spolin
"My vision is a world of accessible intuition" Viola Spolin

www.spolinist.com/new-york

results.description:
Hi Ladies! 

 As you've probably noticed, there's recently been a change in organization in this group. The founding organizer stepped down without naming anyone to takeover. I didn't want to see a group with such an amazing purpose and so much interest just disappear so I have stepped up to be the organizer. 

 I have made a change to the name of the group to NJ Women's Business and Leadership Network and let me tell you why. Many of the skills and topics that are absolutely crucial to being a successful entrepreneur are extremely valuable to women with other paths in life as well. I believe that by increasing the variety of women in the group we will also broaden our knowledge, learn more creative and innovative ways to implement what we learn, and have a more robust network of colleagues and friends. This means more opportunities for everyone to learn and grow! 

 I made this group a little broader so that whether you have a home-based business or a successful start-up, whether you have a leadership role in the corporate world or are just getting started, or even if you are a stay-at-home mom with a strong presence in a charitable organization my hope is that you can find a sense of community and network here. 

 After all I think women in any of those scenarios are in search of the same things: a chance to learn and improve our leadership and management skills and a chance to interact with, and most importantly learn from, like-minded women. As the self-aware women that I know we all are, I think we all accept that we don't know what we don't know and a great way to fill in those gaps in knowledge is to expose yourself to something (or someone) new! 

 I hope you are all as excited about the future of this group as I am. I have some great ideas for future events and for the potential of this group! 

 I look forward to meeting each and every one of you very soon! 

 Kendra
results.name: NJ Women's Business and Leadership Network

results.description:
The Relationship Circle

About the Relationship Circle:

The Relationship Circle is an open, honest and safe forum allowing individuals to explore their relationships with themselves and others, while creating community and connection.  The group focuses on relationships and how we relate to each other in the present moment: uncovering the patterns, context and strategies that keep us from being our whole selves in our intimate relationships.

We will dive deep and resurface with the treasures acquired during this process; start the hard work of shifting and transforming our relationships to create positive, healthy and satisfying relationships within our community of friends, family, work and romantic partners.

About Us:

The Relationship Circle began in Washington DC in September of 2011, led and founded by Relationship Coach Gregg DeMammos.  Since then, it has grown to a group with over 400 members meeting regularly to transform people's relationships and lives.  You can find out more about the origin of The Relationship Circle and read blog entries at www.relationshipcircle.com.

Eva Fernandez, is a licensed couples and family therapist (LMFT) Board Certified Coach (BCC).  She trained as a Life and Ontological coach at Accomplishment Coaching, an International Coach Federation (ICF) accredited school and is completing her ICF accreditation.

As a relationship coach and couples therapist, Eva has helped individuals, families, couples and groups break free from negative cycles and patterns that keep them from forming and sustaining loving and healthy relationships. She will be your guide on your journey to wholeness--empowering you to take control of your emotional health and discover how to create those loving and secure relationships we all crave.

My Philosophy:

We all want to be seen and heard--to express ourselves fully and authentically without being judged, shamed, criticized or rejected. Through the group process, you will learn to give yourself permission to express yourself fully in all aspects of your Self, to recognize the good and the healthy, while unraveling the strategies and contexts that keep you stuck. We will partner to uncover that which has been shunned or pushed to the dark and forgotten--those destructive behaviors and unfulfilling relationships that limit your emotional growth.

My way of being and working with you is warm, respectful, authentic, honest and compassionate. As a group facilitator, my role is to facilitate and move the conversation forward, while attending to the group process and your present moment awareness. The power of group lies in the unique opportunity to receive multiple perspectives, support, encouragement and feedback from other individuals in safe and confidential environment. These interpersonal interactions can provide group members an opportunity to deepen their level of self-awareness and to learn how they relate to others. The Relationship Circle can be a safe and supportive place to experiment with new ideas and ways of being. Together we work at creating a space where you can experience profound change rather than merely talking about change.

Group Format:

The format of the groups will often be topic-driven (structured) as a jumping off point to create powerful conversation.  Other times, group members are encouraged to bring in their relationship issues. 

· The group size is limited to 14-16 people

· This is an open group for men and women

NOTE: For those who are interested in deeper work, there is a closed-group that will be running on Wednesday, April 16th, 2014. This is a 12-week commitment group, limited participants of 8-10, harnessing the interpersonal interactions to deepen your interpersonal skills, self-awareness and learn to create deep and powerful connections in your personal and professional life. 




If you have any questions or would like to schedule an intake for this upcoming group, please email or call: Eva Fernandez, LMFT

call: 646.881.4608

E-mail: Info@InnerPathwaysMFT.com


Stay Connected!

Visit Us: at InnerPathwaysMFT.com

Follow Us: @Coach_Eva

Like Us: Facebook
results.name: NYC: The Relationship Circle

topics.name: Studying for the Graduate Record Exam

results.description:
I have beaten the GRE many times. More importantly, I have helped hundreds of students beat the test without stressing out! If you need to take the GRE, I'm here to help! 

Each session will cover 1-3 of the following:

• Test-taking strategy

• Calculator tricks for the GRE

• Quantitative Comparison strategies

• Arithmetic (and how the GRE makes it hard!)

• Algebra

• Geometry and Coordinate Geometry

• Word Problems 

• Probability and combinatorics

• Standard deviation and stats

• Data Interpretation (charts and tables)

• Prime Numbers, Divisibility, and other "math logic" topics they don't teach you in school!

• Vocabulary Practice

• Strategy for Sentence Equivalence and Text Completion problems

• Reading Comprehension strategies

• Strategies especially for science passages in Reading Comp

• Logic rules and logic-based reading comp

• Issue Essay strategies and practice

• Argument Essay strategies and practice

• Test stress reduction


This group meets at 55 Broad Street (4/5 to Wall St or 2/3 to Wall St) or occasionally in South Slope, Brooklyn.

(Non-native speakers may also be interested in my other Meetup group, Advanced ESL with Jen Dziura.)

I hope to meet you soon!

About Me: I am the holder of a perfect GRE score and the author of two sets of vocabulary flashcards for the GRE, as well as portions of several other GRE , GMAT, and logic books. I have helped thousands of students over more than a decade of experience in the test prep world. I explain things clearly, and I'm pretty nice, if I do say so myself! I have helped GRE students who haven't done math since middle school, students who are struggling with English as a second language, and students taking the GRE for b-school or quantitative programs who need ultra-high scores. I was the first person in my family to go to college, so I understand the struggles of people who are trying hard to succeed.
results.name: Unlock the GRE with Perfect Scorer Jen Dziura

results.description:
Have you taken the most advanced ESL classes the city has to offer, but still don't feel ready to get that masters, MBA, or PhD? Do you feel like you speak and understand English too well for ESL classes, but not well enough to succeed on standardized tests?

I'm here to help! 

This group meets Sundays at 55 Broad Street (4/5 to Wall St or 2/3 to Wall St). Each 1.5 hour session includes 2-3 of the following:

Grammar lessons related to essay writing, beating standardized tests, and academic and business writing

Vocabulary lessons with emphasis on academic vocabulary that appears in textbooks, in business writing, and on standardized tests

Real-world editing -- a writing sample is provided or everyone writes a short composition, and we correct the passages for grammar, idioms, and cultural appropriateness.

Reading comprehension practice -- We read a selection from a standardized test or from a high-lexile publication such as The Economist, The New Yorker, etc., and answer questions that require the kind of close reading required for the GMAT and GRE, and for writing incisive academic essays.

Presentation and class participation practice -- Practice public speaking and speaking up in class.

This is not a test prep class, but would be very effective if taken concurrently with a test prep class, or prior to beginning your GRE/GMAT studies. (You may also be interested in my other Meetup group, Unlock the GRE with Perfect Scorer Jen Dziura.)

I hope to meet you soon!

About Me: I am the author of a grammar, logic, and reading comp book specifically for non-native speakers taking the GMAT (I even went to India to do research!) as well as two sets of vocabulary flashcards for the GRE. I'm also co-author of or contributor to more than ten other test prep books. I have perfect scores on the GRE and SAT, and a perfect 51 verbal on the GMAT. I have helped thousands of students over more than a decade of experience in the test prep world. I explain things clearly, and I'm pretty nice, if I do say so myself! I was the first person in my family to go to college, so I understand the struggles of people who are trying hard to succeed.
results.name: Advanced ESL with Jen Dziura

Surfers and non-Polynesians are welcome to join.

Polynesia - Micronesia - Melanesia

results.description:
Asian Fashion in New York:   This is a Meetup for the study and creation of Asian Fashion.  This meetup is for people interested in Asian fashion and the Asian fashion industry in New York!

This Meetup has a regular Asian Fashion Social Meetup, for social networking.  We also host Fashion Events such as our Asian Fashion in New York Fashion Show.  We are also going to have many side events and Fashion programs during the year.

WHO WE WANT TO JOIN:

• Asian Artists

• Asian Business Professionals

• Asian DJs

• Asian Fashion Designers

• Asian Makeup Artists

• Asian Models

• Asian Multimedia Artists

• Asian Writers (Fashion, Historical, and Social)

• People Interested in attending Fashion events and parties

• People and corporations interested in Sponsoring Fashion shows

• People who love Asian art

• Art Professionals interested in Asian Fashion

THE ASIAN FASHION IN NEW YORK FASHION SHOW!

The theme of all of our Fashion shows is Modern Geisha.  There are different artistic subthemes. Subtheme topics that have been suggested include; Angkor Wat, Tokyo by Night, The Hong Kong Blues, Kung Fu Thursdays.  The styles can be of any Asian culture, and do not have to be Japanese, but they need to match the Modern Geisha theme. shion shows a year.  The number is going to be based on demand.  The main Fashion Show of Asian Fashion in New York is going to be held in November of every year.

Price: Tickets to the fashion show in November cost $50.00 per person for the show and $30.00 per person for the party.  100% of the money from the fashion show goes to the managing of Asian Fashion in New York.  The money goes to hosting our meetings, and producing our events.  Any staff member of Asian Fashion in New York receives a VIP COMP +1, which is a free fashion show pass (COMP), a V.I.P. pass, and a free complimentary pass(+1) for a guest.  Any Asian Fashion in New York member who is staff and attends over 20 meetings receives a VIP COMP +2, which allows 2 guests instead of 1.

Date: The third Saturday in November.

Place: We are going to be having our Fashion Shows in three locations; Korea Town, Chinatown, and in Midtown, Manhattan.

Join the fashion fun!

We are easy to locate and meet in visible, public places.  We send directions via email to all attending members.
results.name: Asian Fashion in New York

results.description:
Bajo el auspicio del Sindicato Nacional de Escritores, el Taller Hispanoamericano de Escritura ofrece sesiones intensivas de creación literaria íntegramente en español, todos los viernes de 6 a 9pm, en el salón de conferencias de la National Writers Union de Nueva York.


Los géneros del curso son cuento, microrrelato, aforismos, memorias y poesía. Contaremos periódicamente con invitados especiales quienes compartirán con los alumnos su particular manera de entender la literatura. 


Nuestra finalidad es enseñar algunas estrategias de redacción orientadas exclusivamente a la creación literaria, tanto en narrativa como en poesía. En el Taller Hispanoamericano de Escritura aprenderemos las técnicas necesarias para narrar un cuento de manera eficaz. Veremos la importancia de la fonética, la métrica en la poesía, la contundencia en los aforismos y la discreción en las memorias. El taller es eminentemente práctico, con ejercicios, lecturas e intercambios de textos entre lo integrantes para su análisis y posterior discusión.


Nuestros talleres intensivos están dirigidos a personas sin ninguna experiencia como a personas aficionadas a escribir. Tenemos el firme compromiso de ayudar a cada integrante en la lectura y crítica de sus propios escritos, y de guiarlos en el uso de las más variadas herramientas.
results.name: Sindicato Nacional de Escritores

results.description:
I'm striving to create/maintain a consistent, weekly "gathering" of competitive (but always cool, friendly, and fun) Magic the Gathering Players for 8-player drafts, casual one-on-one battles, and Swiss tournaments. Basically whatever format the group or players for that week decide we want to tackle.

Me and my friend Nicolai have spent a lot of time building and honing a pretty solid Cube (if you've never Cube Drafted before feel free to message me about it so I can tell you how much fun it is) to draft out of.

I usually host the meetup at the school where I work, in Union Square, in the conference room here. Ideally every week there would be 8 players gathering (pun intended) to draft out of the Cube and play a mini-tournament.

I've been experimented recently with "Team Drafting" which has proven to be a lot of fun. Basically that works with the 8 players splitting into two 4 player teams and then drafting and then helping each other strategizing deck builds.

I also want to mix things up with Constructed formats as well (most likely using Modern decks) or Standard draft days, depending on what everyone wants to do. 

Anyway...if you think you'd be interested join the group and lets play some Magic.
results.name: NYC: Magic the Gathering - Weekly Battles

topics.name: Support for Victims of Domestic Violence

results.description: Hello everyone my name is Antoinette I started this  group because in  2009 I got involved with an abusive man that I ended up marrying. I want to share my story and experiences with  other women out there who are or could be in the same situation I once was in. My goal is to support and help as many women as I possible  can If I only reach one woman to understand the dangers of an abusive relationship and from the devastating  effects abuse of any form can have on a woman ( I myself know this only too well) then I have accomplished something worth doing. Abuse ladies comes in many forms abusive men are also known as sociopath- narcissistic- antisocial sociopath) antisocial sociopath is what my ex- husband was actually diagnosed with when he was sent to prison. I would like everyone to bear in mind that regardless of what problems these men may have there is no excuse in anyway shape or form for their behavior or to abuse or mistreat another person in fact statistics have shown these men know exactly what they are doing and to who they are doing it to also that they are not capable of empathy or remorse statistics have proven that a very small- very small I empathize here percentage of abusive men change please keep that in mind.I have been through extensive therapy and still attend therapy once a week I have researched and read numerous books on abuse all kinds of abuse I have attended Many domestic violence meetings and groups I was asked to speak at a domestic violence benefit back in 2012- I will post my speech on the site- I do this because one it helps me to understand things on a different level regarding domestic violence , myself and the behavior of the abuser . SECOND it gives me the information and knowledge I need to help myself and other woman  before it could possibly be to late. I had another group located in Brooklyn before starting this one that actually went extremely well but I had gotten sick for a little while and  had to closed that group because I wasn't well enough to keep up with it. I have a GREAT amount of compassion-understanding and an anonymous passion to reach as many women as I can to help them realize abusive relationships are not normal or healthy in fact they are extremely dangerous not only just on a physical level but financially -Verbally and can be extremely emotionally devastating to the point where our self-worth and self-esteem are almost nonexistent everything I write here is because I have been through it and without support and the right people in your life it can be extremely hard to overcome it's sad to say but the truth is some people may never overcome what  they have been through but with support and the right people and knowledge we can heal. it has  been my experience that only people who have been through the same situation can really feel and understand our pain I remember I had two women in my last group one woman said to me he doesn't really abuse me he just hits me once in a while and calls me names another woman said and this is the woman I asked to leave my group said that it was okay for men to behave verbally or abusive because that's how she grew up and what her parents did and that it was excepted back then I do not agree with this at all please don't get me wrong I was not being mean or un sympathetic the woman I'm talking about is actually a friend of mine I tried to make her realize that this is not acceptable and that no one has the right to mistreat anyone then or now so I simply said if this is your beliefs  on this matter that it would be better if she didn't attend the group just for the fact that I did not want any woman or anyone to think that abuse is acceptable or okay She actually understood we are still friends but unfortunately she thinks it's okay for men as she puts it to get a little crazy and I believe for this reason she is not able to have a healthy stable relationships for long periods at a time I will always be there for her and love her very much I have faith that one day she will get it right I also might add that at times I let her know that she is welcome to attend the group to listen and learn. My story goes something like this and I'm sure a lot of women can relate I met my ex-husband Jeffrey in early 2009 Jeffrey was loving understanding very giving very caring told me all the things I wanted to hear At the time when I met Jeffrey I had just recently come out of a relationship it wasn't an abusive relationship just that the gentleman I was with who was actually a very  good man had gotten caught up with drugs wouldn't get help and I didn't want to be in that type of relationship that type of relationship isnt  abusive but it is however dysfunctional in my opinion okay back to Jeffrey it was only a few months before Jeffrey's true colors came through it  kind of started very saddle almost as if you wouldn't notice  it But I saw it from the start. at that time because of my own insecurities and self-esteem I chose to ignore it and pretend nothing was wrong  so what started  with verbal abuse neglect disrespect eventually ended in physical abuse I was verbally abused almost on a daily basis with some of the most cruel hurtful words I have ever heard if Jeffrey didn't get what he wanted or if you didn't act the way he thought you should be he became very angry and aggressive I should mention I hid Jeffrey and our relationship from my family for most of the time we were together why you might say? for one because I knew he was an abusive man But at that time I believed I loved him and didn't want anyone to say why don't you leave him get away from him I had so many insecurities and my self-esteem you couldn't pick up with  a shovel that in my head I thought it was better to be with him because my mind was telling me who would want you Antoinette as time went on the abuse got worse and worse verbal abuse constantly physical abuse to the point of a blackeye a dislocated shoulder many  bruises  lifting the mattress in the air while I was sleeping and throwing me off  the bed hitting the dresser against the wall which has now cost me several herniated disc standing and arguing with him one day he grabbed my feet well my ankles which caused me to land on my back and hit my head and causing more injuries now to my neck I remember for some reason a particular time that stands out in my head Jeffrey and I had just gotten married it was only two weeks after our marriage we had a huge fight and I threw him out and he went to stay in a hotel I found out months later he actually had an affair with a prostitute in that hotel I didn't know that at the time I took him back I let him came back home and  and he wanted to have sex So we had sex in the Middle of sex he decided to grab me and push me half out the window naked calling me a whore telling me I like it let everyone see the whore u are this was Jeffrey's way of humiliating me and getting back at me for throwing him out Jeffrey as most abusive man are extremely manipulating not to mention they can be very charming and that is how they are able to  get you to want them even more manipulating abusive men tend to look for vulnerable weak insecure unstable  women they are on the prowl for easy prey I'm sure some of you must be saying why would I put up with something like this but ladies and I'm sure a lot of you know there are many many reasons why women put up with abuse And one of the reasons for this  group is to bring out the points of why we put up with abuse recognize them understand the reasoning and put ourselves on a journey to healing there is more to my story and yes with a happy ending that I will talk about in our group meetings also this doesn't have to only be in groups one on one meetings are also available for women who are not comfortable yet talking in groups. For me the first step in  recognizing abuse was to admit there was abuse and to believe that I am worth more then to be mistreated  and to reach out for  help and support

results.description:
Brooklyn Arts Council is proud to help nurture Brooklyn’s traditional artists and preserve our borough’s diverse heritage though our folk arts program. Our Brooklyn Folk Arts Meet-Ups extend our mission and activities into monthly face to face meetings, at various locales. Past meet-ups have focused on discussing ways to enhance folk arts presentations and grant applications and creating possibilities for cross-cultural and cross-genre collaborations.

Brooklyn Arts Council works with Brooklyn’s traditional artists and their immigrant communities to preserve and present arts expressive of the borough’s diverse living heritage—folk song, storytelling, social dance, foodways, material culture and more. BAC’s folk arts program is directed by a professional folklorist and associates trained in fieldwork techniques—interviewing, photographing, community engagement skills and collaborations. Fieldwork is part of every project that we undertake.

Apart from running, we also do a variety of fun and adventurous activities like kayaking, biking, obstacle races, hiking, river rafting, skiing, etc...

results.description:
This is a group for 20 and 30 something young women professionals in Astoria who are interested in meeting new friends, doing fun social activities together and potentially make lasting connections!

Whether you are new to Astoria or just like meeting new friendly and interesting people, this group is for you! In the past we have planned happy hours, networking events, girls night out, volunteer events, fitness activities, group lectures with special guest speakers, etc. I'm open to new ideas and new experiences, so suggestions are welcome. We set guidelines for the group , concerning cancellations and lateness. This is just to ensure the respect for other members and the chance for everyone to be involved since we have long waiting lists for our events .

1. RSVP Only RSVP if you are sure you can make it . We understand things may come up , but we require you to change the RSVP at least 3 hours before the event . Once is fine , but if it is 3 times or more on a constant basis we have to remove you from the group .

2. Lateness
Please try your best to be EARLY , due to train and traffic delays it's ok to be up to 30 minutes late unless it's a sit down restaurant . ( brunch or dinner) . If you are more than 30 minutes late to an event more than 3 times you will be removed from the group . If you get bumped up from the waiting list last minute or an hour before the event we of course will not hold that against you . We understand you may have other plans by then. Again these new guidelines are in place for all fairness to everyone .

results.description:
This is a peer-run support/self-help group for those with Social Anxiety Disorder or extreme shyness. We exist to help those with social anxiety to participate fully in their lives. Our philosophy is that it's important to develop your goals and dreams and be guided by them, and not by your social anxiety. Our group is safe. Since you must have SAD to join (this does not need to be formally diagnosed), everyone has similar challenges and will understand and not judge you.  We meet weekly; the time and day of the week varies depending on location. We have a structured format which is based on therapeutic methods, research, and strategies that have worked for other people. We strive to be goal-focused and set goals based on fear hierarchies that are personalized to our values and goals in life.  This is an opportunity to practice socially anxious situations in a safe environment, in a no-pressure atmosphere.  You don't need to do anything that makes you excessively anxious, and won't be forced to do anything.  The idea is to progress gradually.  Do not let your social anxiety keep you from coming to these meetings!  We are here to help.  If our locations are not convenient for you, please contact us so they we can keep a list of where there is greatest need. Please contact us with any questions or concerns.  Please check our new website at www.findyourvoicenj.org, or email at support@findyourvoicenl.org.

As stated above, this is a peer-run group.  We are not licensed therapists or mental health professionals.

There is a one-time fee of $15 for a 13-week series of meetings.  The first meeting is free and introductory, to get a "feel" for the group and format to see if it is right for you.  We use a workbook containing all the material and lots of supplemental information that is $15.  The 13-week series can be repeated as many times as needed until you reach all of your goals.  You will keep setting new goals with each series.  The locations are:

Moving Forward Self-Help Center: 25 Elizabeth Street, 2nd Floor, New Brunswick, NJ 08901. (Near Route 1 and Route 18). Serving Middlesex, Somerset, and Union counties, and parts of Mercer and Monmouth counties.

Senior Horizons Apartment Complex: 714 Clifton Ave, Clifton NJ 07110. Serving Passaic, Morris, Essex, Bergen, and Hudson counties.

Meetings at other locations will be announced.  Please let us know if you are interested in a particular location.

If you are joining while a series is in session, you are welcome to come as a guest and sit in for a meeting or 2, then start from the beginning of the series when it repeats.
results.name: Find Your Voice (Central and North Jersey Branch)

results.description: Skipping Club is BACK for Summer 2014!! Our old Meetup group got deleted but we hope you all find us again! Michelle Joni's Skipping Club is a fitness party in motion that brings back the joy of skipping. The Skipping Club Summer 2014 season is May 29 - Aug 7, a full summer of themed skipping adventures. Right now, it's training season at Little Skips in Bushwick, where you can skip and learn all about it April 10, 17, 24, and 26 at 2PM. For New Yorkers in the know, Skipping Club is a great source of fitness, a dose of joy in our week, a visceral way to get outside our comfort zones, an excuse to dress up, and a way to journey back to our youth. It's also a unique way to see the city and a faaaaaahbulous social outing. Every Thursday at 2 - and select happy hours, nights and weekends, Skipping Club skips a one-mile route, with intervals, exploring a new neighborhood around the city. From the Upper West Side and Central Park to Williamsburg, dive into a new theme - sartorially and spiritually. Enjoy curated music, improv-style games, meditations, urban adventures and a delicious hand-picked food and drink spot. Come skip, rediscover your playful innocence, paint the streets with joy, emit waves of positivity into the universe, and find your rhythm! I invite you to step into my imagination... and yours.
results.name: Michelle Joni's Skipping Club

results.description:
Reiki Love New Jersey is a place for like-minded individuals throughout the area to come together and share their beautiful gifts. We hold our events in different places in central NJ, so don't pay too much attention to the listed group location!

We focus on a form of energy healing known as Reiki. What is it? It is better understood when broken apart. Rei is universal Wisdom and Ki is life force energy. When put together, Reiki means Universal Life Force Energy that is Divinely Guided. What Divine means is completely up to you: Reiki carries no dogma and requires no specific way of thinking, so it is compatible with any religion or set of beliefs. 

When people practice Reiki, they put aside their ego and thoughts to act as a simple channel for the energy, the same way a wire allows electricity to pass through. Anyone and everyone can benefit from Reiki, as the energy helps regulate blocked or deficient Ki. Your Ki is affected by your state of mind and your day-to-day life, and energetic disturbances eventually cause illness and dis-ease.  Reiki practitioners help restore your body, mind, and spirit to the natural state of pure perfection.

Reiki is a way to purify the holistic self, reduce stress and anxiety, and ultimately further one on his or her spiritual journey. Each person takes something different away from a session, because Reiki is always for your best and highest good. If you've never received it before, we encourage you to come to a share so that you can have a taste and see what it's all about.

Come join other beautiful souls as we share, explore and unfold the magic of Reiki!

https://www.facebook.com/njreikilove
results.name: Reiki Love New Jersey

results.description:
We call this a home game because it's played out of my living room (where I live with my girlfriend). Lately, we've been playing on our PRIVATE ROOFTOP - check out the pics! But this won't last as the weather gets colder. Then we'll take it back to our living room.

We're right here on 13th and 3rd, steps away from Union Square. 

We now open the game up to anyone interested, but screen tightly. We're looking for fellow normal people. We screen out thugs and riff-raff. It is not an intimidating group at all. Just seriously fun, relaxed vibe. If you killed the vibe, you seriously wouldn't be invited back! 

No one is out to "crush it" and try to pay rent with their poker winnings. There is one True Donkey here. It's seriously fun when he starts losing and goes on tilt. We all have a great time laughing at him while he whines about whatever hand being "so sick". He takes it like a champ, and it's all in good fun. 

How do you NOT wanna be a part of this good time?

FYI, in case it's not obvious: Please note that even though it may say that only 1 or 2 donkeys are attending the weekly meetup, the fact is that we are ALWAYS playing on Fridays. Almost all RSVPs happen via text, so you won't see the RSVP count increase on Meetup. 

Coming????
results.name: East Village - Donkey $1/3 Poker Holdem NLHE Cash Game

results.description:
NEW YORK ADVENTURE CLUB


UNLOCK YOUR CITY

We give you insider access to the city’s best-kept secrets. But we’re so much more than a tour company.


WHO WE ARE

We are a community-driven club that curates the most unique experiences in town, with a focus on history and storytelling. We show you a city you never knew existed, and offer a community you can’t live without.

You won’t find our special-access tours and exclusive events anywhere else. Think after-hours tours of New York City’s most celebrated spaces, themed parties in unexpected locations, and weekend excursions to incredible destinations. All of our events end with social hangouts so you can meet people who love exploring as much as you do.


THE ‘CLUB’ IN NEW YORK ADVENTURE CLUB

Our current community is more than 4,000 members strong and includes everyone from recent NYC transplants to lifelong residents. Whatever borough you’re from (or city or country, for that matter), we’ll make it easy for you to take full advantage of the unique places and great people this city has to offer.  


WHERE WE GO

To ensure a one-of-a-kind experience each and every time, we handpick events and outings specifically for the New York Adventure Club community. Recent events include:

* An all-access tour of Grand Central Terminal, including a visit to the catwalks, secret FDR tunnel, and basement

* An after-hours tour of New York City Hall
* Special access into some of New York's most coveted private social clubs, including the Explorers Club and National Arts Club

* Petting baby kangaroos, holding sloths, and feeding leopards at Staten Island Zoo
* A behind-the-scenes exploration of the Woolworth Building with the building manager

* An NYPD Precinct tour, including a meet-and-greet with detectives and Emergency Service Unit crew members

* A tour of the Polish Consulate led by the Consul General and Vice Consul General of Poland
* An after-hours flashlight tour of Green-Wood Cemetery and catacombs

* A special-access tour of Brookhaven National Laboratory and its Relativistic Heavy Ion Collider (RHIC)

* A Halloween party in a historic gothic crypt, complete with a five-piece brass band


 See our past experiences for a look at our most recent adventures.

For now, our experiences are based in and around NYC, but we plan to expand to other cities soon.


QUESTIONS?

Drop us a line at info@nyadventureclub.com and we’ll happily answer.


Unlock Your City with New York Adventure Club.


P.S. - Sign up with our weekly newsletter to stay up to date with interesting events around town!
results.name: New York Adventure Club

results.description:
This is a meetup for people interested in Bayesian Statistics, Stan, and related technologies. We'll have talks, Q&A sessions, and workshops.

Stan (http://mc-stan.org) is a probabilistic programming language implementing full Bayesian statistical inference with

• MCMC sampling (NUTS, HMC)

and penalized maximum liklelihood estimation with

•  Optimization (L-BFGS)

Stan is coded in C++ and runs on all major platforms (Linux, Mac, Windows).

Stan is freedom-respecting, open-source software (new BSD core, GPLv3 interfaces)

* The image "Relative Number of Births" is courtesy of Aki Vehtari. The model is explained in Section 21.2 of the third edition of the BDA book on page 505.
results.name: Bayesian Data Analysis

results.description:
The NYC Strobist & Photoshop Collective is for people who own a Digital Camera with on or off camera Flash and want to learn to use them in a social setting. 

Photographers 

We look for those who have an interest in "Off Camera Flash" photography - commonly known as STROBIST photography. Members joining this group should be comfortable with basic concepts of how to manipulate their camera to take a photo and able to use their camera outside of the Auto mode. We also encourage those who wish to learn or improve their skills with post processing of digital images using Lightroom, Photoshop and various image enhancing plug-ins. If you often look to another photographer and are not afraid to ask for help or offer solutions you may find you are a good fit with this energetic and active group of snappers. 

Models

If you are a model or ever thought about giving it a try, you are also welcome to join the group and take advantage of serious photographers of all levels. Great place to network, allow practice for both ends of the camera, build portfolios and practice collaboration and skills that come with being a part of a shoot! 

Makeup Artists

We welcome you as well to join the group to practice your skills, try new concepts, network and build your portfolio!

More Info

Please see out About page: http://www.meetup.com/nycphotocollective/about/ to see if our group is a good fit for you.

Dues are $5.00 per year to help us cover costs for the meetup group. You can bring dues to your first meetup. No refunds are offered for this meetup group.
results.name: The NYC Strobist Photographer and Model Collective

results.description:
This is a group for anyone in the NYC area that is passionate about Oracle Application Express (APEX) and is interested in meeting like minded folks to learn, share ideas, and have fun.

For those of you not in the know, APEX is a declarative framework for building web applications on the Oracle database. Using only a browser, and armed with just minimal knowledge of application development, it is possible to create robust, secure, and scalable web applications. APEX applications utilize the latest HTML5 and CSS3 technologies and even include a feature that can dynamic behavior to applications via JavaScript without having to write any code (Dynamic Actions). 

We are looking for sponsors! Do you have an APEX related event or job opening that you would like to let members of ORCLAPEX NYC know about? For $100 you will get up to 2 people into the event, a place to put your shwag, and a chance to introduce yourself to the audience. Please contact us if you are interested in being a sponsor.
results.name: ORCLAPEX NYC

results.description:
This is a friendly group for anyone looking to find or land a new job OR get the word out about a job opening in your network. Whether unemployed, unhappily employed, interviewing, a recent grad, or a recruiter, this is for all career levels and situations. I am a career strategy and job search coach with a background in executive recruiting and hiring. I started this group because I want to help people navigate the job hunt in a savvy, successful way, while also connecting with others in similar situations.  

My networking philosophy is all about meeting a variety of people, asking for a job and helping others by giving away job help in return.  You never know who is in someone else's network so by sharing your needs and giving job leads to others, you will start to build new relationships and potentially generate your own job leads in return!
results.name: Stamford Savvy Job Seekers Group

results.description:
Calling all long island meditators! Come join us for a group meditation on long island that will change your life. All religions and denominations are welcome. Come experience for yourself, the incredible social and personal benefits of group meditation. There have been numerous studies that have shown that a group of people meditating has significant measurable effects. The beauty of a group meditation is that you can experience both self-exploration while also connecting to the energy of others. Long Island Meditation is a great place for beginners and experienced meditators alike. Come on down, make some new friends and surround yourself with a great group of spiritual, like minded people interested in finding inner peace and happiness.



We are currently meeting at Fuel the Soul, 188 Merrick Road in Merrick NY. The talks begin at 7:30 and the guided meditation begins promptly at 8.


Some helpful Q&A:

What should I wear?

-Please wear comfortable clothes and bring a yoga mat.


Who will be there?

-This meet-up consists of other like-minded Long Islanders interested in experiencing the benefits of Meditation. This is a beginners class so it's very laid back and comfortable. Please feel free to come by yourself or bring a friend.


What can I expect?

-The Long Island Meditation Group meets at Fuel the Soul at 7:30. We typically have a guest speaker that offers a brief talk about one of the following subjects; Reiki, Yoga, Meditation, Empowerment, Spirituality, New Thought & Healing. The group guided meditation begins promptly at 8. 


What are people saying?

-Here is a testimonial: I've been attending Mark Chabus' guided meditation workshop for the past 5-6 weeks. By nature, for the past few years anyway, I've turned into a real worrier and pessimist, due to a few downturns in my life, so I thought I could use this class. Well, there was another bump in the road in my family life (my daughter lost her job) but instead of my typical hand-wringing, poor us, reaction, I felt a sense of anticipation and excitement for her...automatically, without trying. I feel I've been re-wired by Mark's weekly guidance and my subsequent daily practice. Would I say it's a miracle?  I think so...... The point is, it works.  Come join us and see for yourself.  Thank you, Mark. I'm SO glad our paths have crossed.  -C.O.


Where do I park?

You can park in the AT&T Parking lot. You can also park on Merrick Road or on the side street in between Pastrami King and Dunkin Donuts.
results.name: Long Island Meditation Meetup

results.description:
Primordial Voice (PV) practice is a shortcut to your primordial self, to your own unique power, to your true, authentic being. Primordial voice is given to every single human. It is and intelligence on its own, the most amazing inbuilt guidance system, it is a healer within. PV is active in children up to the age of 3 years and can be activated during sexual experience, a serious illness or a form of mourning which is actually a healing vibration.
Through Primordial Voice Technique you can reach untapped phenomenal abilities everyone possesses. These abilities are often hidden deep inside and accessed through the power of one’s own Primordial Voice, a very powerful teaching allowing to re-recognize one’s own strength.

Primordial Voice teaches you to reach forgotten self confidence and live in agreement with your own true self. A grown-up person has 2 voices: a “thinking” voice which is active, and primordial one which is usually dormant. A “thinking” voice is a voice connected to the intellect that communicates the data registered by the brain. The vocal cords and muscles are used to produce a thinking brain. Primordial Voice is connected to the “gut” or “heart” , it is produced by trachea and smooth muscles that are connected to our subconscious mind. It communicates our inner wisdom, our inner guidance; it says, “I lead you, I guide you”.
Knowing your Primordial Voice and recognizing it is the most powerful tool to the secret of life, making the right choices, committing to the right situations, and interacting with the right people. Remember, you have spent many years trying to change yourself just to fit the general standards, to acquire qualities that are not yours and do not reflect your unique nature. The question is whether or not you have succeeded? And does your success set you free?

Primordial Voice is not about changing or improving: it is about KNOWING yourself and living in accordance with your TRUE SELF. Knowing who you are is the key to your freedom. The PV program is a course consisting of several stages of special exercises, breath work and energy work, and although it takes time to master this technique, even one hour of this work will give you the experience of what it is like to be your own master. Suppression of your Primordial Voice creates patterns of disharmony and disruption of your body/mind connection and well-being.

By opening to Primordial Voice and freeing its movement in your body, you will experience:

Connection with the source
Freedom of the creative force within
Feelings of bliss and happiness
A strengthening of your intuition
A shifting of blocks in your life force (Qi)
??????????????????????
Personal power
A deepening and improvement in your voice
An expansion of personal skills and professional effectiveness
You will be heard!
And you will learn how to heal yourself with Primordial Voice on a deep physical and emotional level.

results.description:
Albertson Memorial Church
293 Sound Beach Avenue
Old Greenwich, CT 06870

ABOUT OUR CHURCH:
Albertson Memorial Church of Spiritualism is a member of the National Spiritualist Association of Churches and the Connecticut State Spiritualist Association.

OUR PURPOSE:
 We are passionate about spreading the message of Spiritualism: The knowledge that after our life in the body ends, our spirit lives on. It is reassuring beyond words to know this truth - which we demonstrate through Mediumship (communications with spirit). Our mission is to share the light, love and knowledge of spirit without divisive dogma or restrictive rules. We create an open and loving atmosphere within the Church; one which welcomes people from all faiths and denominations.

WHAT IS A MEDIUM AND/OR MEDIUMSHIP?
A medium is a person who is sensitive to the thought and energy vibrations which come to us from those in Spirit. A medium can attune to the Spirit people, and is able to describe them and relate their thoughts, emotions, memories, and messages. Mediumship is a natural gift of the Spirit and has many purposes: it brings comfort to the bereaved; it offers spiritual nourishment for the soul; it becomes a vehicle for God’s Healing Spirit; and it demonstrates the potential of the individual to break through self-imposed limitation and, thus, become part of a Greater Whole.

WHAT IS SPIRITUAL HEALING?
An important part of of the Spiritualist experience is healing. Healers are simply channels for healing; the source of all healing is God. Our trained and designated healers direct healing light and energy according to each individual's needs. At every Sunday service during a period of meditation, we offer the opportunity to sit in one of our healing chairs for hands-on energy healing (given by a touch on your shoulders).

IS SPIRITUALISM A CHRISTIAN DENOMINATION?
Spiritualism is the vehicle through which all religions have been given birth. We embrace the teachings and example of Jesus of Nazareth. We consider Jesus a great prophet, medium and healer. His connection with the Divine was so strong that one could consider him as God's Presence on Earth. Was he the only such manifestation of God's Love and Grace? No. During times of spiritual crisis, God sends messengers of the Word to help guide us; Jesus, Abraham, Moses, Buddha, Krishna and Mohammed, to name a few. One can be Christian and a Spiritualist; one can be Jewish and a Spiritualist; one can be Buddhist and a Spiritualist; etc.


SUNDAY SERVICE:
The highlight of our Church week is Sunday worship. Our worship service integrates music, prayer, healing, meditation, inspiration and Spirit communication into the beautiful and unique experience of Spiritualist worship. Each week our church invites a guest minister. Sunday service begins at 11:00 AM and ends at approximately 12:15 PM. You are cordially invited to join us in the Church Hall for coffee, refreshments and fellowship following the service. (Doors Open at 10:30 AM for Silent Prayer and Meditation).

The Typical Order of Service:

• Opening Song and Prayer

• Declaration of Principles

• Sermon / Sharing

• Healing Prayer and Meditation

• Laying-on-of-Hands Healing

• Offering

• Announcements

• Hymn

• Spirit Greetings (Mediumship)

• Closing Song: "Let There Be Peace on Earth"



WORKSHOPS:
Our guest ministers and other spiritual practitioners provide workshops on various subjects relating to Spirituality, Mediumship Development, Psychic Development, Healing and much more. All are welcome to join - newcomers are encouraged! There is a suggested donation listed for each event (however, we do not turn anyone away for inability to pay the full amount). Many of our classes are held on weekdays in the evening, and on Sunday after worship. Please check our calendar of events and/or web site (which is updated more frequently) for additional information regarding exact dates and times.

PSYCHIC / SPIRITUAL FAIR:
Albertson Memorial Church holds a Spiritual Fair on the first Saturday of every month from 12pm-5pm. (Please note: our July Fair will be on the second Saturday , July 12, NOT on the July 4th weekend!) Psychic readings are 25 minutes each and range from $40 to $50. The energy healing sessions are 20 minutes for $20. Healing is also available for pets (leash or carrier only). Admission is FREE -- cash and personal checks are accepted -- reservations are not needed, but you may email albertsonchurch@gmail.com if you want to reserve a spot!

• Church web site: www.AlbertsonChurch.org

• Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/AlbertsonMemorialChurchOfSpiritualism
results.name: Albertson Memorial Church of Spiritualism

results.description:
Product Secrets is a monthly meetup where we invite an expert on a specific topic to teach us their secrets and help people in product development do their jobs better. We think that the best way to solve the challenges that come up in product development are to get everyone involved in a room together - if engineers, designers, and product managers can all have an open conversation together, we think they're much more likely to come up with good ideas.

We were tired of all the meetups we went to being uninspiring and full of recruiters, so we built the meetup we've always wanted. Each month, we host an expert in a specific topic to answer the question "What's your secret?" The goal is to help everyone who attends learn something that can help them take a new skill or idea with them to work the next day. We also have a strong focus on networking, because making connections with other interesting people is where we think most of the value in these meetups lies.

Important: this meetup is for product managers, engineers, designers, and other people actively working on a digital product (support specialists, QA engineers, company founders, etc). To that end:

• Fill out your member profile accurately and completely. As each event fills up and the waitlist grows, we will give priority to people who make it clear what they're doing, what they can contribute, and what they want to learn.

• Recruiters are strictly prohibited from attending. Business development and marketing professionals are welcome to attend if they are interested in product development, but people with a more direct involvement will get priority in the case of an oversold event.
results.name: Product Secrets

results.description:
Sometime in the late sixteen hundreds, this very bright British chap named John Locke defined goodness as that which creates happiness. Sounds good so far. Almost two thousand years earlier another also very sharp Greek dude named Aristotle wrote that not only is happiness the greatest good, it’s the only end in life, everything else being just a means. Okay, that makes sense too.

This group has two goals. The first is to explore the relationship between happiness and goodness. The second, much more fun, goal is for us to become much happier just by getting together and talking about happiness. The theory behind this second goal comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them whenever and however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions:

1. Keep busy and be more active

2. Spend more time socializing

3. Be productive at meaningful work

4. Get better organized and plan things out

5. Stop worrying

6. Lower your expectations and aspirations

7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking

8. Become present oriented

9. Develop an outgoing, social personality

10. Work on a healthy personality

11. Be yourself

12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems

13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness

14. Put happiness as your most important priority.


Here's some background on the research our group is based on:

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group, and those are our goals. It's also very, very important that we have fun. With that in mind, let's get ready to get good and happy!


Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change

By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions

By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages
results.name: The Happiness and Goodness Club - White Plains

Hello and Welcome aboard! I formed this walk group for people who are new to the area (or old) or even considering moving into an area and would like to explore the different cool parts of the towns and cities along the Hudson. I always feel that people move into a specific area only after having probably zipped through the neighborhood sitting in a car. Well yes, one does get a "vague" idea of the place but do you really get to enjoy it? Then do you come back again and again to take in the flavour? Maybe, maybe not. So as a way to give back to the society I decided to form this meetup. Usually the walks will not be over bearing or long. However for your & everyone else's enjoyment, you have to be physically fit to be walking and being on foot for at least an hour or more. To keep it interesting we can end the walk in an interesting place to eat or drink from time to time. Every meetup we'll be exploring different areas for Jersey City, Hoboken and West NewYork. If you want more cities to be added feel free to get in touch with me.

*Members should understand and agree that they will be obligated to pay the bill for the food or drinks they have incase the meetup ends at a place of food or drinks.

*As a member of this group you are not allowed to solicit other members for your products, business or services. NO EXCEPTIONS! This is a meetup for fun lets keep it that way.

* If you RSVP to a meet you are expected to show up.

*No shows will be strictly not tolerated! You have to inform at least 24 hours in advance.

* You have to wear comfortable and appropriate clothing and foot wear.

Liability Waiver:
Walking and similar outdoor activities have inherent risks associated with it. Your participation in my walks, carpools or other events could be dangerous and can result in serious injury, medical emergency or even death. You agree to participate completely at your own risk and understand that you are taking full responsibility for your own safety and well being at all times.

results.description:
Life is always full of challenges, often causing stressful situations. We can not eliminate challenges, however can learn to manage them in a manner that can avoid 'burn-out' and increase our ability to handle stressful situations. Quiet often, these stressful situations are too common in our daily lives and can be seen as 'normal' living and one gets accustomed to unhealthy living or life conditions. There are various ways to deal with stressful issues and situations. Relaxation and deep-breathing is one of those techniques that has been scientifically proven to show positive result and health benefits. The deep breathing and relaxation, or meditation are well known in the ancient 'Wisdom Traditions' and have been practiced for thousands of years. Often, the objectives were to seek spiritual awareness, introspection, self-exploration, single-mindedness, cultivation of mindfulness, and connecting with 'Higher-Self'. I modern day living, regardless of how we approach, we can deny the benefits achieved from the practice of deep-breathing for relaxation, connecting with our inner-self, promoting our own well being from the regular practice of Relaxation Techniques.

We have programs for beginners, practitioners, and small or large groups.

Schedules and Costs:

results.description:
Apache Mesos is a cluster manager that provides efficient resource isolation and sharing across distributed applications, or frameworks. It can run Hadoop, Jenkins, Spark, Aurora, and other applications on a dynamically shared pool of nodes.

Features:

• Fault-tolerant replicated master using ZooKeeper

• Scalability to 10,000s of nodes

• Isolation between tasks with Linux Containers

• Multi-resource scheduling (memory and CPU aware)

• Java, Python and C++ APIs for developing new parallel applications

• Web UI for viewing cluster state

One way to think about the difference between Mesos and "cloud" solutions is around how they manage their resources.  There is a lot of latency when using Hypervisors (which is what cloud environment use). Mesos operates with cgroups at the kernel level giving you the same isolation but faster from a network, and system perspective.  

Mesos also abstracts out the scheduling of resources from the management of resources giving you the ability to create any type of scheduler that makes sense for you (or use existing ones) and still get the same kernel benefits.  Think of your scheduler as init.d for your data center servers as a whole and Mesos as the kernel of your entire data center and every computing server in it.
results.name: Apache Mesos NYC Meetup

results.description: We meet every Sunday from 7:00-8:15 pm at the Wellspring Health Collective in Maplewood. Whether you are a longtime meditator or new to the practice, you are welcome to join us. Instruction will be given. Together, we can practice staying grounded in the present moment by stopping, focusing on our breathing, and observing our thoughts and feelings without getting lost in them. By sitting and walking in this way, we can gain clarity, spaciousness and the ability to stay present to whatever arises without reacting habitually. By continually practicing with the support of community, our commitment to living mindfully is strengthened and our concentration deepens. There will be guided and silent sittings and a period of walking meditation, along with a reading and time to share and practice mindful speech and listening.
