results.description:
Are you looking to meet girl friends in the Millburn/Cranford NJ area (Short Hills, Springfield, Summit, Madison, Chatham, Maplewood, Westfield, South Orange, or surrounding area)? Are you in your late 20's to late 30's? Are you new to the area or interested in meeting some friends in the area for meals, drinks, happy hour, brunch, outings, day activities, sporting events, picnics, crafts, etc. etc.? If so, than this might be the group for you!!

As one member said, she is looking for a group in the area that is beyond a singles group but before a baby group -  and that is exactly where many members of this group tend to fall!

There is no bias against those a bit further from Millburn/Cranford nor those single or with kids. This group was created to find like-minded friends to get to know and hopefully build meaningful friendships. Most events will be limited in attendance (5-15 ladies) in order to better get to know each other.

We have events within this group that repeat each month, including:  monthly coffee meetup (Sat morning) and monthly book club meet-up (new book each month).  Other events for this group include:  paint & wine class, mud run, hike (fall), picnic in the park, wine tasting, concerts/shows, and of course dinners, drinks/happy hour, and brunches!  Suggestions for meetups are always welcome and several of our members take on the role of 'event host' to pick/plan an event at the venue/date of their choice!  :)  

NOTE:  The goal is to keep this group on the smaller side (~120 ladies) and therefore members who are not active (those who don't attend events and/or message and keep in touch with the group) will be removed.  New members will be added occasionally to keep things fresh.  Eventually, we'll have a core group that is actively engaged, which is the key here.  I appreciate your understanding!  

FEE - why is there a $5/year fee?   Because MeetUp groups cost money (the organizer pays) and prices just went up a lot this year.  $5/year covers the cost of the group and  perhaps helps find members who are more serious about joining a great group!

Governance - in order to best maintain this group and to be considerate of others, there is a "2 limit no-show policy"  - because these events are smaller, if you are a no-show at 2 events, you will be removed from the group.  Reminders are sent the week of the event and  meetup reminds you as well - so if you signed up for an event and can no longer attend, just let me know (or change your RSVP) and we'll have another member take your spot.  This is especially important on events requiring reservations or those with a wait-list.   Understanding that life gets busy, non-active members will be removed after 4 months, unless they've reached out to the organizer for reasoning.  Thank you!

results.description:
You're in this group because you love people & community! Our meet-ups involve home-cookin' and sharing experiences. Our typical meet-ups are in homes, around the dinner table (or sitting on the floor!), enjoying homemade food. 


Like to eat? This is the place for you. Meal Sharing makes it possible to find awesome home-cooked meals in locals' homes. We are the New York Meet Up for Mealsharing, the international platform that connects people to home-cooked meals all over the world. It's in over 450 cities...so let's MealShare here in NYC! 

Join up for some good homestyle cooking, new friends, and community involvement. This is the New York Meal Sharing group, where Meal Sharers can keep in touch with their community and with travelers coming through! We get and make home-cooked meals from both across the world and from across the street. We love food and people! You don't need to be backpacking to get a homecooked meal anywhere.  We want to bring our stories, our recipes, and our cultures to the table and share them. Everyone who eats or cooks is welcome to be a part of Meal Sharing! How to be involved?

• Be a Meal Sharing guest

• Be a Meal Sharing host

• Spread the delicious word

Check us out on our website and keep us with us on twitter and facebook! If you'd like to host a mealshare, here the link!
results.name: Meal Sharing New York

results.description: The goal of UX Debate Club is to provide an appropriate forum to challenge and test popular wisdom, fight dogma, and develop new ideas. At conferences, events, and even Meetups, it is usually not appropriate to challenge a presenter's thesis without looking like...well...a jerk, but as UXers we want to see people's thought process and how they arrived at their conclusions. A debate is a great way to do just that, and we get to collectively look at problems, questions, or theories from both sides. The UX Debate Club uses an Oxford-Style debate format to encourage everyone to participate while exchanging ideas, banishing dogma and having fun.
results.name: UX Debate Club

results.description:
Welcome to the Greater Stamford Toastmasters Club.  Every Tuesday night is a fun time where you get to hone your public speaking skills, build your leadership skills, and network with a great group of people in a supportive environment.  Did we mention that we have talented evaluators providing feedback on things that you’re doing well and areas where there is opportunity for additional growth.  We like to call ourselves the best damn club on da planet, a phrased coined by a previous president.  The club is 60 years old and still thriving.  Come out and see for yourself what you’re missing on a Tuesday night.  Our meetings run 90 minutes long and frankly you’ll have such a good time you won’t even notice that 8:30 has arrived.



All interested parties should feel free to join us at any of our Tuesday meetings.  Experiencing  a live meeting gives you first hand experience of what to expect in a Toastmaster’s meeting.  Come out prepared to participate and start working on those skills right away.  Membership information is available on the site and we can also answer your questions in a meeting or via email.
results.name: Greater Stamford Toastmasters

Cannabis and Hemp Association Website<br>

The Cannabis and Hemp Association is an organization established in May 2014 to rapidly educate and provide networking opportunities to people interested in the miracle plant, cannabis. 

The CHA is focused on (3) initiatives:

1) Building Community-We give people with an interest in cannabis an opportunity to enjoy FUN and SAFE events in and around the New York Metropolitan Area.

2) Raising Awareness-Create media and exchange ideas to explore the latest news and discuss the history, people, places, and things involving cannabis.

3) Taking Action-Developing programs (such as this Meetup group) to further the acceptance of cannabis at the local, national, and global level.


We hope you will join as an Affiliate and consider becoming a Member. When you are a Member of the CHA you will officially align yourself with an organization doing positive initiatives, outreach, and a multitude of projects. As cannabis becomes more understood and further celebrated, having an association to a group can potentially be something of value when networking with others within the industry. 


------------------------------------------------------------------



Meetup.com "CHA Affiliates" are not CHA Members and should not represent themselves as such. CHA Membership is available online at cannabisandhemp.org only.<br>

Please go to our website for more information or contact us: cannabisandhemp@gmail.com CANNABISANDHEMP.ORG

We blog on all matters cannabis and hemp on the website. If you have any news to report or discuss please checkout the blog on cannabisandhemp.org


LIKE US ON FACEBOOK.COM/CHAWORLDWIDE

TWITTER @CANNABISANDHEMP
results.name: Cannabis and Hemp Association-New York

results.description:
This group has 'street hockey' in its name because we play traditional street hockey! Traditional street hockey comprises sticks and sneakers. Not roller-blades. While we do sometimes play roller hockey, you should assume that a given session is the traditional sort. You're welcome to bring your roller blades and muck about in them before or after our sessions. Occasionally, we also mix things up such that each team, for example, will have have 4 people in sneakers and two in blades. And it always works. 

Our games tend to run at an intermediate level. While some players are quite advanced, others are sometimes completely new to the game. 

If you're totally new to the game, you should feel welcome. If you'd like some tips or even lessons, I'm happy to offer them - and for free.  I love coaching, and my experience at it is fairly decent: I've coached people of all abilities - including players who went on to make pro leagues. Most recently, I provided one-to-one training for a 2014 US women's deck hockey player. Feel free to take me up on the offer because I really do enjoy it!

There is a small fee for each session. Just $5. All proceeds go to a non-profit sports program I created (and run) for NYC's underfunded public schools: see nyisl.com for more information.

EQUIPMENT: 

On almost every occasion, we will have proper hockey nets as well as two goalies. When two goalies aren't available, we will set up 'pond hockey goals' - i.e., small goals or targets.

It would be great if you could bring your own stick. But if you don't have a stick, write the organizers and they'll be able to bring you one.  Make sure to specify if you shoot Left or Right!

While we don't require that you wear any protective gear (and while most people don't even wear gloves), you should seriously consider the merits of gloves, shin guards, mouth guards, and helmets with cages.

RULES: 

Standard rules of hockey apply, with some minor exceptions (see below). 

To help ensure safety - especially for those who choose not to wear helmets, face masks, mouth guards, or shin guards - we have a few very strict 'stick-related' rules:

1. No stick lifting.

2. No hacking (i.e., no smacking your stick on top of someone else's stick).

3. No sticks above waist height at any time.

4. No slap shots.

5. No using the stick against someone's back, front, side, between the legs, or anywhere else on the body - even if it's a light touch. 

A quick demonstration of what is and what isn't allowed will be performed by an organizer before every session.

MOST IMPORTANTLY, in order to help foster an easy-going, welcoming and safe environment, this group also has a strict non-violence & non-aggression policy :

**** If a player uses his/her stick in any violent way; if he/she throws a punch, elbow, or kick; if she/he threatens another player or challenges another player to a fight; if she/he uses abusive or offensive language towards another player, then the player in question will be immediately removed from this meetup group and permanently banned from future participation. ****

By signing up to this meetup group and to any of its events, you agree to the following LEGAL DISCLAIMER.
results.name: NYC Street Hockey

results.description:
Vihangam Yoga revives the lost science of consciousness as taught in Veda and Upnishad by authentic Sadguru.  It has five stages of Meditation to make the practitioner start from controlling the mind and reach upto union with supreme being. The five stages of meditation are as described below:
Stage 1:
Controlling mind by truly knowing the place where it resides when awake and catch it right there.  Remember controlling THOUGHTS and NOT MIND is just like controlling heat and not fire. Hence stop fiddling with thoughts but learn how to control THE MIND directly
Stage 2:
Purification of Mind at the inner abode of trijunction of Ingla, Pingla and Sushmana in the sound and light of Aum

Stage 3:
Learning how to open the secret 10th door (Dasham Dwaar) through the experience of Kundalini Jagaran

Stage 4:
Attaining Atma Sakshatkar (Self Realization), Experience of Cosmic Executor and Experience of Eternal Sadguru

Stage 5:
Realization of Supreme Being and attaining Union


Ever wondered how Ancient Sages and seers succeeded in controlling mind and awakening the dormant power of consciousness to realize the self as well as supreme being? Ask simple question - Where does the mind reside in your body when awake, when dreaming and when in deep sleep? If you don't find an answer to this very basic question how can you expect to attain control over mind. THE MIND needs to be known first before knowing how to control it. Vihangam Yoga sessions unfolds all secrets around MIND and CONSCIOUSNESS. Learn the Vedic technique of Meditation through the free Vihangam Yoga sessions nearby you. Browse to www.us.vihangamyoga.org to learn more about Vihangam Yoga and free sessions around you.

New York Finance And Banking Meetup is a community of professionals at any level whether you are an experienced financial professional or looking to start your career or just looking to gather some information about the finance industry .

If you work in finance or a related industry like investment banking, commercial banking, hedge funds, private equity, public equity, LBO, credit, M&A, accounting, economics, consulting, corporate finance, etc. then this is *definitely* the group for you.  

Main event focus: Investment Banking, Sales & Trading, Brokerage, Private Equity, Hedge Funds, Asset Managment, Wealth Management, Venture Capital, Angel Investment, Start-Up funding, business networking.

The purpose of meetups is to bring together and introduce professional members of the New York City financial services industry to one another, share helpful information and provide opportunities, as well as to socialize to meet new friends, and to network to improve our connections.Anyone who works in the Finance industry knows how important it is to build professional and social networks in different areas of finance to make ourselves more mobile in finance.

results.description:
MOMally (pronounced MOM-uh-lee) is run by Andrea Scannell, MSEd, CLC.  Andrea is a Certified Pediatric Sleep Consultant and Certified Lactation Counselor.  MOMally hosts several weekly groups that provide support to new and expecting parents. MOMally also hosts occasional special expert-led workshops on CPR, sleep training, baby wearing, infant care, and more. This is also a forum in which local moms (Astoria, NY) can host events of their own. 

Join this group if you are an expectant parent or a new parent with a little one (newborns to toddlers) in the Astoria, NY area. This is a wonderful community of moms and dads.

When you request to join make sure you have a completed profile using your real name (first and last, please) and a profile picture of YOU. Please take a few minutes to answer the questions thoughtfully so we can get a sense of who you are and why you'd like to join.  As this community grows, we're working hard to maintain the intimate, safe small community energy--personal introductions go a long way.  Thanks!

The $20 fee applies to all new members

Please also request to join our private FB groups.  Membership in the FB groups is a short 2 step process: After filling out this short survey http://goo.gl/forms/aMXqydCN58, request to join our general parenting group, MOMally Parenting and our local group, MOMally Astoria.

For more info visit www.momally.com

results.description:
This Meetup was created in the hopes of having one central listing for all NYC history related events in the city.   In a way this is more of calendar than it is a Meetup, but if people enjoy this resource then I would be down to create more social types of event.  And if you do plan to go to an event feel free to RSVP and invite people for pre- or post- event hanging out.

  Also if you enjoy this resource and want to help out please feel free to contact me.  I want to add events from as many sources as possible, but it might be a bit much for one man.

  Also a few disclaimers.  

  One, I do own a sightseeing company for full disclosure, but I will mention which if any events are from my company.  I don't think I'll list many at all or for a while.

  Two, I will provide links to all the venues with the event posting.  If you want to confirm that you will be able to join an event check there to see if it's been canceled or is sold out.

  Three, event hosts in this Meetup means that they manage the posting, not that they will actually be attending the event (unless they say otherwise.)  If you are attending the event and want to let people know RSVP.  If you would like to do something before or after the event let people know in the comments.  With that having been said here's the criteria for the events I list.

  1)  Must be New York City related in some way.  Related being the key word.  If there's a talk on the Dutch colonial period, but not specifically on New York I might throw it in the mix. 

  2)  Must be history related in some significant way.  Doesn't have to be all history based to qualify.  A tour of the High Line that talks about the future plans of the site in addition to it's history is fine.  An event that only talks about present or future events will not be added.

     For the purposes of this Meetup I will say it will have to deal with events at least 20 years old to be "historical".

  3)  Daily or weekly events will not (for the time being) be added to this Meetup to prevent clutter.

  Enjoy and please feel free to give me feedback.

  SOME PLACES WE CHECK FOR EVENTS:

  BROOKLYN BRAINERY / BROOKLYN HISTORICAL SOCIETY / BROOKLYN PUBLIC LIBRARY / MUSEUM OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK / NEW YORK CITY DEPARTMENT OF PARKS & RECREATION / NEW YORK HISTORICAL SOCIETY / NEW YORK PUBLIC LIBRARY / THE MUNICIPAL ARTS SOCIETY 

  We also check other random sites out.
results.name: NYC History Event Listings

results.description:
Welcome to the World Taiji Boxing Association - Erle Montaigue's Fa-jing Ch'uan School of Fighting and Healing in New York City. This is a group where you can keep updated on classes, workshops and special events offered by the school. 

The Old Yang Style is the style of T'ai Chi Ch'uan developed originally by its founder, Yang Lu-ch’an, in the 19th century; a style that has its roots in Wudang Chuan and Dim-Mak, which confers on it its Medical/Martial nature; consequentially leading to a better communion with the Universe, as it was originally intended.

Even though this is the original system, nowadays what is widely known as Yang Style T'ai Chi Ch'uan is the style developed by one of Lu-Ch'an's grandsons, Yang Chengfu; a man who did an extraordinary job by simplifying the form and training methods to make them more accessible for everybody, disregarding their current health condition or age. Yet, its medical/martial origin was gradually stripped from it by subsequent generations of practitioners, rendering a form that is definitely better than not doing any type of physical activity, yet not able to deliver all its unmeasurable potential. 

Therefore, a difference must be made between this worldwide known style, and the original style that was passed down by Lu-Ch'an's other grandson, Yang Shou-hou, and preserved by the World Taiji Boxing Association, that will enable the serious practitioner to take advantage of all the benefits offered by the work of geniuses. The training takes the practitioner through self-healing, martial and, eventually, medical levels of apprenticeship and practice. 

A more detailed primary training is as follows: 

-Self Healing and Martial Qi Gong 

-Yang Lu-ch'an's Form

 -Tui Shou (Push Hands) 

-Small San Sau (Self Defense form) 

Feel free to come and train in any of our classes, where you will find an environment where friendship, cordiality, respect and lots of hard work is the rule.
results.name: World Taiji Boxing Association - New York City

results.description:
Moyu, meaning breast milk in Korean, is ShinYeon Moon’s attempt to re-nourish her memories of an uprooted past. By letting go of the past and the uncertainty of the future, she is attempting to find solace in the present. Through her artwork, she contemplates how to maintain a meditative balance in life, illustrating her attempts at finding stability in the blur between the real and the imagined, amidst the lonely silence and strangely comforting space that remains in the in-between.

/nām/ mirage, Solo Exhibition, MKFS Gallery, Mount Kisco, NY, February – March 2014
Generations IX: The Red/Pink Show, A.I.R. Gallery, Brooklyn, NY, November – February 2014
Dark and Scary Salon Show, The Greenpoint Gallery, Brooklyn, NY, October – November 2013
The Print Exchange, Graphic Arts Workshop, San Francisco, CA, July 2013 / Robert Blackburn Printshop, New York, NY, September 2013
Poetics of Translation, Kimmel Galleries, New York, NY, May – June 2013
[null], Cantor Media Center, New York, NY, May 2013
Oro, Commons and Rosenberg Galleries, New York, NY, April 2013

RESIDENCIES:

Selected for cover, BRIO Journal, Fall 2012

results.description:
Welcome to NYC iOS Swift Developers!  We are thrilled with the response to this Meetup, and excited to help introduce and develop Apple’s new programming language, Swift, with our community.  We welcome anyone interested in iOS development to join our Meetup, but before signing up for an event, please note our format below.  

What this is:

A group of developers of varying backgrounds, coming together to discuss and begin the transition to Apple’s new programming language, Swift.  From week to week, we will cover a variety of functionalities across Swift, Cocoa, Objective-C, and Xcode 7 with a focus in iOS 9 for Apple’s multi-touch devices.  While we have general topics that our organizers will cover during each Meetup, we will not be locked into an agenda.  Instead, we will use the time to share / develop ideas and information in an informal, discussion format.

What this is not:

This is not a Meetup for those who are brand new to / have no experience in development.  We are not teaching a course on Swift, presenting slides, or giving assignments.  If you are interested in learning iOS development and / or Swift, please get in touch with our co-organizer, Matt Knedler at mknedler@adev.us, who will be able to give you more information about the various courses we offer in NYC and Stamford, CT. 

Subject experts are welcome to present topics relevant to iOS development at future Meetups. If you are interested in presenting at a future meetup, please tell us which topic(s) you’d like to present when filling out your profile, or by emailing mknedler@adev.us.

About our Organizers:

Aferdita Muriqi, CEO, ADEV, Inc.

Aferdita Muriqi has over 18 years of experience in development, design and analysis of mobile and web enterprise applications.  In 2010 she founded ADEV, Inc., a global mobile application development company comprised of a talented team of mobile designers, engineers and marketing specialists.  Aferdita currently conducts iOS development bootcamps for corporations and individuals throughout Stamford and NYC, and serves as an adjunct professor at NYU-SCPS, teaching multiple iOS and Android app development certificate courses.

Aferdita has extensive experience building custom mobile and web applications across a vast array of topics including e-commerce, music and entertainment, social networking and business applications.  ADEV services range from initial concept, design, development, testing, product delivery and video production focused on innovative applications and promotional solutions. 

Thanks for visiting, and we hope to see you soon!
results.name: NYC iOS Swift Developers

results.description: I will begin with a quote from Rob Collie (Excel Guru): "YOU are the army that the world needs. You just needed an upgrade to your toolset. PowerPivot provides that upgrade and then some. I would say that we probably needed a 50% upgrade to Excel, but what we got is more like a 500% upgrade; and that is not a number I throw around lightly. Imagine the year is 1910, and you are one of the world's first biplane pilots. One day at the airfield, someone magically appears and gives you a brand-new 2012 jet plane. You climb inside and discover that the cockpit has been designed to mimic the cockpit of your 1910 biplane! You receive a DRAMATIC upgrade to your aircraft without having to learn how to fly from scratch. That is the kind of 'gift' that PowerPivot provides to Excel Pros." The purpose of this Meetup is to explore this new "toolset" and push our Excel data-crunching prowess to the maximum. I would like to begin with the founding members, going chapter by chapter, as a group, through Rob Collie's book, "DAX Formulas for PowerPivot, A Simple Guide to the Excel Revolution". I imagine, that if the group grows, those founding members will then be well-versed enough to provide instruction and guidance to new groups members. This is a very exciting new technology, applied to the most ubiquitous business tool in the WORLD!!! I personally would say that this is the best thing to happen to Excel, since Excel!
results.name: Business Intelligence with PowerPivot and DAX

Some of the tech topics that we cover include gems from Google's lineup including the likes of: AngularJS, Google Cloud Platform (Compute Engine, App Engine), Google+, Google Drive, Node.js (based on Chrome's V8 engine), Android, Google Glass, Dart, Go, Google Maps API, Web Search, Google Cast, Java and Python just to name a few. 

We're a very interactive group with regular events such as tech talks, codelabs (hands-on coding sessions), all-day devfests, hackathons, tech trivia events, collaborative events with other local groups and many other special events. 

Stop procrastinating, press Join, and come code with us!  

Make sure to follow us on Twitter (@gdgnorthjersey) and Periscope (@gdgnorthjersey) 

Disclaimer: GDG North Jersey is an independent group; our activities and the opinions expressed here should in no way be linked to Google, the corporation.

results.description: Welcome, GWEN of New York City is dedicated to mentoring women on how to conduct business from the heart. You can only learn it from other women who have gone before you and are dedicated to showing you the way. Feminine business entrepreneurs work on the principal of exchange. Women want to be in business for ourselves but not to be in business by ourselves. Successful women don't come from working smarter or harder, they come from belonging to a global network of women, all dedicated to conducting business from the heart. As women we understand the true meaning of service and that gives us a great advantage in an economy where fortunes will be made by people serving other people. If you have the heart to help other woman and are open to the love and support that business women around the world can bring and if you have exhausted all of the traditional possibilities for earning success, please join us to open your heart and open your eyes and see the new business reality unfolding all around you. Expect to receive the respect you deserve for all the incredible service you've done for the people you love; to feel appreciated by other women who have also made great sacrifices and to meet women like you who began practicing our unique approach and they will become your mentors, coaches, your role models and, most importantly, your friends.

results.description:
America's sports and entertainment landscape is more diverse than ever before. Hip hop rivals pop and country music as the most lucrative music forms in world. Spanish language radio and TV ratings out-perform its English language counterparts in many of the largest media markets. The NFL, MLB and NBA each have various ethnic and racial groups highly represented on the field or on the court.

Yet the staffs and front offices of these venues, teams and promoters don't always reflect the diversity on the field, on the stage or in the stands. The Institute for Diversity and Inclusion in Sport reports that the NBA's player population stands at 81 percent men of color yet only 7 percent of team CEOs are Black, Latino or Asian American. In music, three of the top-grossing concert artists are Jay Z, Beyonce and Bruno Mars but what percentage of the arena's sales and marketing staff are people of color? When working at a venue or with a promoter, how do you connect with industry colleagues and other resources to help you market and sell more tickets to diversity markets?

Our group seeks to to do three, fun things to help:

1. Network! We have a network of sports and entertainment sales, marketing, PR and venue operations professionals that would love to get together and network and make new connections. We also know lots of people would like to explore getting a job with a sports team or a art house venue but don't have the knowledge or the connections. We could be a fun group to learn more and make those connections.

2. Attend Live Events & Meet Insiders. We also look to schedule outings where we can to see a great show or sporting event but get something a little extra - like see a show then have an artist meet-and-greet or attend a sporting event and then meet current team employees to learn about the industry. There are lots of great opportunities for these kinds of outings throughout the NY/NJ region.

 3. Have Fun! That's why we don't sell or market something boring, after all :) We hope you can join us for some fun outings with like-minded professionals.
results.name: Dahday's Live Sports & Entertainment Industry Insiders Group

results.description:
The law uses reason in language for social good. That will never change. 

We are a collection of Lawyers, Cognitive Scientists, and AI Programmers focused on applying both manual and automated cognitive systems to all aspects of the legal profession. Modern Cognitive Science uses quantitative methods to better understand language use, reason development, and human behavior. Heretofore, the legal profession has engineered a cogent "case" before a judge and jury. These seem to be two sides of the same coin: one quantative and the other intuitive.

In our monthly meetings, held physical in NYC and cyber presented into the USA, we compare and contrast the empirical method of Cognitive Science to the intuitive skills of a well trained legal mind.

If you feel the findings in Cognitive Science now has application to the legal profession, please phone or drop in.

The Organizers.
results.name: Cognitive Lawyers

results.description:
Lesson one - Every sales pitch, whether your selling a washing machine, or your latest work of fiction, should include a call to action with a benefit.

Welcome to JMFNJFWGHM aka, the group with no hope of a memorable acronym. This is a mastermind group for people interested in the art and business of fiction writing. Our motto - "when one boat rises, all boats rise." 

Below is some basic information. Please visit the various other sections of our site for more details.


Our Goals

Ours is not your typical meetup group. Our primary focus is to help writers at all levels of development, to evolve and improve both their skills as a writer, and their knowledge  and abilities in aspects of self-publishing. We do this by pursuing four goals.

Goal 1 - To Sharpen our writing skills through discussions of craft and technique, by performing fun group writing exercises, and by critiquing each others work in a structured format.

Goal 2 - To add to our knowledge of the  craft and business of writing, through the selected readings of some of the best books on the market. Each month our group will read one book from a list of selected titles. What we learn from each book, will be the basis of our discussions as we share ideas and experiences, building on the material we've read.

Goal 3 - To explore the rapidly grow opportunities arising from the world of self-publishing through discussion and sharing of experiences and ideas. Building mailing lists, construction of marketing funnels, building product catalogs, calls to action, e-book pricing, hybrid publishing, paper print vs digital - all these subjects and more will be examined.

Goal 4 - To network with like minded writers, to share ideas, to encourage, to mastermind. Writing can be a lonely pursuit. It often helps to get together with those walking the same path as you. As the group grows and gets comfortable with each other, additional gatherings may be arranged, from an occasional get together over a few drinks or a cup of coffee, to going as a group to a writers conference (RWA 2015!).


Who This Group Is For

This group is primarily for story tellers, writers of fiction and memoirs. While all writers within these categories are welcome, it should be noted that this group will be especially geared towards the entrepreneur, the person(s) looking to write professionally, or at least make some supplemental income. Self-publishing will also have a strong focus, though we will also touch on traditional and hybrid publishing during the course of our journey. Existing professional writers are more than welcome (we will worship you accordingly), as are beginners and everyone in-between who have finally decided its time to pursue that dream.

The group is length agnostic - short stories, novella's, novels, serials, all are welcome. The group is also genre agnostic. Whether your writing westerns, science fiction or romance, the crafting of story shares the same techniques and difficulties.


Which is Why ...

Writing groups are notoriously tough to start and maintain on meetup.com. With your help, we're going to be different. While we appreciate you joining our little "kickass" group, "just joining" and three dollars will help pay for coffee. SHOWING UP to a meeting is what really counts! Come to a meeting. You will have fun, sharpen your skills and learn tons of valuable stuff.

Lesson two - start with a call to action, then end with a call to action. See you at the next meeting:)

results.description:
Are you looking to grow your business? Then you need to join us at Profit Partners! We are part of BNI, the world’s largest networking organization, and are a dynamic, dedicated, growing business referral group which meets weekly on Tuesday mornings in East Brunswick, NJ. In the past three years we have successfully passed over $2,000,000 in new business.

Advantage of membership in a Chapter is that only ONE member per business category sits at the table so no competing within a Chapter.

How do we generate so much business? It is through Word-Of-Mouth advertising. Each member of the Chapter is a part of each others marketing team thus increasing your marketing reach. Each referral given is a Qualified Lead; i.e., the referral is looking to do business with the Chapter member. No Cold Calling!!!

While located in East Brunswick, we have representatives from Edison, Metuchen, Caldwell, Garwood, Piscataway, Freehold and more doing business throughout NJ and in NY, Pa and across the nation.

Want to learn more, visit us on Tuesday mornings. Meet our members, network and see how we can help your business. Also, visit our website at www.bnirg.com and check out our members and businesses represented. Don't see your business represented, contact us or visit us on Tuesdays.

results.description: Rick Perry talks cavalierly about secession.  I say let him go.  You believe in a progressive tax system, gun control, universal health care, a woman's right to choose, evolution, global warming, the right to vote, low interest rates on student loans, Keynesian economics, a federal stimulus to rebuild our crumbling infrastructure.  "They" don't.  It's time for an amicable divorce.   Let's talk about how we can bring it about. results.description:
This Meet-up Group was started because we saw a need for plus size fashion bloggers to connect. If you're a plus size fashion blogger or just a fashion lover living in the DC, Maryland and Virginia area (DMV) or New York City area (NYC), let's unite! We are looking for fashionable, amazing bloggers and business owners to represent the DMV and equally fashion savvy and creative bloggers and business owners to rep for NYC. We’ll connect the two cities via blog collaborations, networking and socializing. And of course, there will be events, virtual and live, so we can get to know one another (being part of this Meet-Up, you will gain a sisterhood/brotherhood).

You must have a genuine, positive attitude, and be willing to work with other entrepreneurs in ways that are mutually beneficial because that is what the group is all about! We are planning tons of events at great venues. This group is for all Fashion Bloggers from the DMV and New York City area (all boroughs and counties are WELCOME).

Small business owners focused plus size fashion, design, jewelry or accessories are also welcome. If you are a fashion/lifestyle blogger, boutique owner based in the DMV or NYC this meetup group is for you!!!

For Membership Consideration:

Must have been blogging for 4 Months+

Must have a FASHION or LIFESTYLE blog catering to the plus size and curvy community

Must apply with a meetup group photo

Must fill out the questions in Full

Must include a link to your blog

For professional reasons we do NOT accept members who are owners/founders of PR Firms, Social Media and Marketing Firms and the like, but we do work/collaborate with people in those positions.

Thanks so much for your interest! We look forward having YOU join the team!

“I don't do fashion, I AM fashion.” ― Coco Chanel

results.description:
Meet your new crew. <br>

<br>

Take out a piece of paper, number it 1 through 10 and list the things you want to do before you die. From bushwhacking our way through hiking trails to hang gliding, stand up paddleboarding, and spelunking, we also love our hot pot, twisted card games, and epic karaoke backup dancing. Some things you just can't unsee. So come out, meet some new people, and let's start adventuring.

<br>

Also if you want to host an event, just let us know! We're just a bunch of friends hanging out, nothing too formal :p

<br>

1) Flakers be warned, don't flake! Or else the typical tarring and feathering, pointing and laughing, at risk for being banned for life kinda deal. Unless maybe you bribe us with food and alcohol. We like food and alcohol.

<br>

2) We operate by carpool unless otherwise specified. Any volunteers are greatly appreciated!

<br>

3) For events, you are responsible for buying your own tickets. If you can't make something, you take that hit.

4) We are hardcore! lol but seriously some of this stuff is "dangerous" or "life threatening". By joining the group you acknowledge that anything you do is at your own risk and everyone is responsible for themselves, AKA we are not liable.

<br>

5) Have fun! And smile! You are so much hotter that way!

<br>

results.description: Meet up to ride the best rivers of New England in style FREE with a trained and licensed whitewater rafting guide. I have all the gear (boat, paddles, cooler, life vests, safety gear, wetsuits when necessary) and experience/certifications (5 years or 500 days of professional guiding experience in ID, CA and WV/swift water rescue certification/wilderness first responder certification) but not looking to take things too seriously unless safety dictates caution. To be blunt (yup), drinking and smoking at camp and maybe on the river. Not appropriate for children or the faint of heart. 2014 schedule includes a float on the Deerfield River in Massachusetts (7/12), Pennobscot River in Maine (7/13), Kennebec River (ME, 8/2) and Dead River (ME, 8/3) and could run any of those rivers the Friday before or Monday after those weekends too (Im a school teacher and itll be summer) but would need at least three people to pilot the raft safely. MUST HAVE A CAR. Seats will be given on a first come/first serve basis. Any questions contact me at adam.schreibs@gmail.com or call at (215)720 6574. Bring booze and a tent.

This group is for anyone who has ever been frustrated getting In The Zone consistently with their Golf Game. We introduce simple techniques you've probably never seen or heard about before that will help you to naturally play your best more often and have more fun. Our focus is on the mental game and the mind-body connection that's 'really' in charge of how well you play. You'll be amazed at how easy it is to Play Better Golf Now!

 
We'll show you how unwanted thoughts (even unconscious ones!) and stressful emotions get in your way and help you fix this once and for all. You will even learn how to help yourself eliminate painful restrictions in your golf swing movements and improve your range of motion.


If this seems all too good to be true then come out for one of our free introductory seminars and see for yourself how these simple techniques can truly help you play better golf now. If you don't see a meetup time that works for you then let us know so we can organize one for your club or group.

 
Goto www.GolfEmpowermentZone.com for contact info and to find out more about how these techniques work.

results.description:
Welcome to Pure Bliss Yoga!

While practicing indoors allows for a steady practice and lots of conveniences, yoga practice is meant to be outdoors, and so are we. This group celebrates life, the great outdoors and yoga, the union of it all.  So, in addition to our indoor classes at Shala Zen-i, we try to schedule whenever possible outdoor yoga and mindfulness events.  Please see our class schedule and event sampling list below. 

To our existing members - please help us welcome newcomers by sharing your experiences and reviews on Meetup, Facebook or Yelp.  We have an awesome community, so help us grow it!  Please reach out to Jeni if you are interested in hosting an event or joining our leadership team.

ABOUT SHALA ZEN-I:  "Shala" means "home" in Sanskrit.  Our yoga shala is hosted at the residence of our group organizer in Fort Lee, NJ.  It is an open, light-filled studio that can accommodate over 15 yoga mats and even more people for events like potlucks, meditation or talks. Overlooking trees and filled with the sounds of birds and crickets during the warmer months, it is our urban oasis nestled in the heart of Fort Lee.  It is only a block away from Bridge Plaza North bus stop and there is usually plenty of street parking. Because we are so easy to get to, we have yogis coming from Manhattan, Fort Lee, Edgewater, Cliffside Park, Englewood, Englewood Cliffs, Palisades Park, Teaneck, Leonia, Ridgefield Park, Hackensack and many other Bergen and Rockland County towns.

PRICING:  Our membership dues are voluntary and just $25 annually - a small amount for you, but a huge help for us!  It covers the fees that MeetUp charges us, buys yoga mats and props and helps with some of the other event expenses.  Use the "CONTRIBUTE" button or follow the embedded links.

Our regular indoor and outdoor yoga is just $15 per class. Special events may have different rates. 

You can pay by cash, check, or credit card - either online through our Meetup page or on location. Your support makes this community great! THANK YOU!  

RSVPs and ATTENDANCE POLICY: Online, phone or email reservation required. We reserve the right to cancel any class or event if there are fewer than 3 confirmed members signed up.  Kindly try to arrive 5 to 15 minutes before class times, so we can begin on time, and please update your response if you are no longer able to make the class.  

CLASS SCHEDULE: Generally Wednesday @ 8pm and Sunday @ 6PM, but please check our calendar as the schedule may change from time to time.

EVENT SAMPLING (see our calendar for more):

March 15, 2015 - Yoga and Vegan Pizza Cooking Class at Shala Zen-i

Warm weather Sundays - Yoga in The Park in Fort Lee Historic Park, NJ (right off the GW Bridge with scenic overlooks of Manhattan) or in Overpeck Park, Leonia, NJ.

Alternate Saturdays through September - SUP Yoga on Long Island Sound - Five Islands Park New Rochelle, NY.

Our outdoors events tend to be family, kid and pet friendly.  You can confirm specifics with the event organizer.

Hope you join us on our journey to greater vitality, spiritual growth & healing, inner peace and pure bliss.

Namaste,

Jeni
1.518.406.8077
www.pure-bliss-yoga.com or www.fortleeyoga.com
www.facebook.com/PureBlissYogaCenter
results.name: Outdoor Yoga, Fort Lee NJ Studio Yoga, Hikes & Retreats

results.description:
AN EDUCATIONAL BRIDGE ACROSS NEW ENGLAND FOR CLOUD SECURITY

BOARD DIRECTORS: More Information

Chair:                  ViJay Viswanathan
Co-Chair:            Peter Vogt
Board Director:  Dennis Brixius
Board Director:  Thomas Guy Osa
Board Director:  Shahryar Jahangir
Board Director:  Bryan Chnowski
Board Director:  Tom O'Brion 

LOCAL ORGANIZERS:

Connecticut:        Thomas Guy Osa
Massachusetts:    Open
New Hampshire:  Darrin Maggy
Maine:                   Tom O'Brion
Rhode Island:        Open
Vermont:               Open

PLEASE JOIN US:  

The Cloud Security Alliance (CSA) promotes best practices for secure Cloud Computing and advances the uses of Cloud Computing. The CSA is a not-for-profit organization led by a broad coalition of industry practitioners, corporations, associations and other key stakeholders.

The CSA New England Chapter is a not-for-profit organization (application pending) with a mission to promote the use of best practices for providing security assurance within Cloud Computing, and to provide education on the uses of Cloud Computing to help secure all other forms of computing.  

CSA New England Chapter events (chapter-wide events) are organized at our website at CSA-NewEngland.org.  Our website will be republished in August with content, event registration information, and information not posted on this Meetup site.  In addition to chapter-wide events, we will be holding localized meetups and lunch-and-learns throughout the New England region. We will be posting this information to our chapter's LinkedIn group and to this Meetup site:  

Meetups are managed by our local organizers.  Our goal here as a CSA Chapter is to act as a bridge across New England for security practitioners to foster better communications and networking between the most northern states (ME/VT/RI/NH) and Southern New England (CT/MA). 

We invite you to join the New England Chapter of the CSA at our LinkedIn page.  

MEMBERSHIP IS FREE. 

Joining this Meetup Group is not mandatory for membership in our Chapter, however if you wish to participate in lively discussions and would like to stay close to the more localized meetups (smaller local meetings managed by our regional organizers), please do consider joining this meetup group.  

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION (more about our chapter)

Local event and registration information will be posted to our New England Chapter LinkedIn Group and to our chapter website (EventBrite Registration) for CSA National Events, Quarterly New England Events, Lunch-and-Learns, New England CyberSecurity Speakers Bureau, and our annual chapter event: 

The Annual New England CSA Security Awards Banquet Dinner

New England CSA on LinkedIn: Signup      National CSA on LinkedIn: Signup
results.name: CLOUD SECURITY ALLIANCE (CSA) NEW ENGLAND CHAPTER

Since the People's Climate March in NYC several of the groups that were involved in the NYC Host Committee for the march have been meeting to maintain some of the momentum and amazing network of connections that were developed during the march mobilization.  We call ourselves People's Climate Movement - NY and we are comprised of grassroots climate justice organizations, unions, faith-based communities, educators, health professionals and social justice advocates. 

This Meetup is a place to list any climate related event, workshop, meeting, get-together, idea sharing day, art project, etc....  in one calendar so our growing community can see what each other is up to and join in.  We welcome all comers. 

"To Change Everything we Need Everyone"


The original purpose of this Meetup group, 2014:

In 2014, several groups in environment, environmental justice, labor, faith... have collaborated to create People's Climate March on September 21st 2014 in NYC. Several events have been created to work toward this goal and to create community beyond September 2014. This is a place to list any event, workshop, meeting, get-together, idea sharing day in one calendar so our growing community can see what each other is up to and join in.

topics.name: Families of Children who have ADD/ADHD

results.description:
ADHD Info Sessions

This informational session will consist of two parts an interactive presentation providing an overview of the neurobiological basis of ADHD and how that impacts executive functioning. It's kinda like an ADHD 101 workshop. We will cover the myths and realities of ADHD referring to the most up-to-date research and evidence out there. 

When: 

(CHECK CALENDAR FOR UPCOMING EVENTS) 

Where: 4 Davenport Rd. Greenwich, CT 06830 

Cost: $10-20 suggested contribution

Groups are facilitated and moderated by Aaron Smith, MS, LMSW, a trained mental health professional and founder of Potential Within Reach a local ADHD coaching, training, and advocacy organization.

Parent Support Group 

Raising a child with ADHD can be a challenging experience. That's why we formed this group! This group provides a supportive space for parents to connect, learn strategies to address your child's behavioral or academic concerns. We encourage you to share your experiences, ask questions, and gain valuable insights on how to best work with your child's ADHD. Remember you don't have to struggle alone. You will get feedback from a supportive community of other people who have had similar experiences living with ADHD and exclusive access to an ADHD coach/mental health professional. Our meetings are informative, as well as a venue for building relationships and sharing resources. 

Takeaways: You will learn practical skills, strategies/tools to succeed with ADHD, network with others parents/families impacted by ADHD, and work together in a mutually support environment to constructively address challenges.

Cost: FREE/Complimentary

ADHD Workshops 

We feature monthly workshops on certain ADHD topics. Workshops are designed to provide participants with an overview of the topic and a chance to engage with others to find resources, strategies, and solutions. Topics are generated based on member feedback. If you are interested in a particular topic, please reach out to us and we will take your feedback into consideration.  

Cost: $10-20 suggested contribution 

Groups are facilitated and moderated by Aaron Smith, MS, LMSW, a trained mental health professional and founder of Potential Within Reach a local ADHD coaching, training, and advocacy organization

Adult ADHD Networking & Productivity Sessions

Coming soon.... Come to this group for a lively discussion of workplace issues related to ADHD. Find support from other working adults living with ADHD. The purpose of this group is to provide a space for mutual understanding, tips/tricks that work to enhance productivity, share apps/systems for time-management, and find ways to harness your unique abilities and leverage ADHD traits for success on the job.
results.name: ADHD Workshops & Support - Greenwich, CT

results.description:
Hello my name is Raj and I am the organizer for Hoboken Jersey City'n Around Women's Group. As a girl who loves making friends and socializing I couldn't find a meetup for casual social lounge arounds. Most groups are happy hour party or toddler mommy focused. Hey what about us girls who want to make real friends, who do real stuff that are as diverse as the emotions we have?! 

Are you New to the area? Have your friends moved away? Got married? Had kids? This group is for ladies who are single, married or divorced, who want to have some fun and not just make new friends but also make friends for a lifetime. Having a hobby or a full time job or being a mother is great but time to time we all crave to just hang out with a few like minded folks to just chit chat over a cuppa coffee or go out with occasionally. We'll go to the movies, museums, farmers markets, dine out in local restaurants, try different cuisines , go out bicycling kayaking, plan picnics, happy hours and hey hey ! Ladies nights will always be welcome. In other words this is a social group that doesn't just focus on one thing. 

This group is created to provide a way to meet women mainly between the ages of 25 - 50 who can meet and simply be sociable. Women from any background are welcome to join. 


 *Members should understand and agree that they will be obligated to pay for their own expenses including food or drinks they have in the meetup(unless specifically mentioned in the particular meetup)

*As a member of this group you are not allowed to solicit other members for your products, business or services. NO EXCEPTIONS! This is a Meetup for fun lets keep it that way.

* If you RSVP for a meet you are expected to show up.

*No shows will be strictly not tolerated! You have to inform at least 24 hours in advance.

Liability Waiver: You agree to participate completely at your own risk and understand that you are taking full responsibility for your own safety and well being at all times
results.name: Hoboken Jersey City N around Women's Group

results.description:
(Attention)-When first signing up for ID purpose please provide a photo of yourself in your profile thank you. We are a 60+ social group of cyclists who enjoy riding together along the many miles of 'road' available in Westchester. From Bronx River Parkway Bicycle Sundays to The Walkway over the Hudson destination of the Duchess Rail Trail, there are many trails, Called the South and North County bike paths, and safe roadways waiting for us in the Bronx,Westchester and Putnam County and beyond. 

We offer rides at all levels, from the beginner’s level to the advance +level 

We will have bike tours every now and then on a weekend throughout the season 

We will also post after work rides: (we called it ride and eat rides) in the summer. 

With weather permitting we post a average of two to three events a week including weekends.   

The group will have a beginning of the season get together and an end of the season get together.

We, each, individually challenge ourselves to keep a competitive pace, recognizing a diversity of limits, and still take time to stop and smell the roses. Most all events allow for time to socialize, grab a bite to eat, and encourage the bond that comes with riding together.

We are not a professional organization, just a group of like minded individuals who share an interest in cycling.  When you RSVP YES for an event, you agree to be responsible for your own safety and your guest and , your equipment, and hold no one else liable for any accident, injury or event.

For great inspiration and a taste of how much  we love cycling and want you to love it too, see this amazing introduction by Tom: http://www.meetup.com/Westchester-Social-Cycling/messages/boards/thread/26306702

results.description:
We're a Meet-Up group created to focus on having fun outings like lunches, dinners, movies, and we'd like to even organize trips to museums and art shows. We also can take the time to discuss internal and external disabilities and the challenges that go with them, but we also want to have fun first and foremost since from experience we know how much a serious condition takes on your social life. We feel that as important as discussions are, so is keeping our social lives active.

So along with discussing our challenges and trading histories, and maybe even learning some new coping mechanisms, we want this group to have fun and exciting excisions, to have people meet new friends and possibly even have some members meet friends that last a life-time.

We want to emphasize that we're going to not just focus on what we cannot do, but focus on what we can do to live life to it's fullest. We can even plan group events we didn't consider possible individually but together, maybe we can make it a possibility. We want a chance to come together in spite of the challenges, and together share suggestions for helping each other in welcoming more fun and socializing into our lives. 

Please share your suggestions for Meet-Ups with us, we're open to anything and everything within reason. We hope you'll join us, and thank you for your time. We hope you feel well and have a wonderful day!

Susanna & Adam - I Love Life! - Brooklyn, NY

CLARITY STATEMENT: My intention for this group was to gather with other Deadheads in Recovery in our homes or otherwise drug and alcohol free settings to listen to Grateful Dead Music, or watch Grateful Dead video, while we socialize around the music, recovery, finger foods, etc.... A hangout of sorts. 


Wharf Rats are a group of concert-goers who have chosen to live drug and alcohol free.

Their primary purpose is to support other concert goers who choose to live drug-free, like themselves. They announce their presence with yellow balloons, signs, and the Wharf Rats information table. At a set break during Grateful Dead (and related) concerts they would hold 12-step style meetings but are not affiliated specifically with any 12-Step organization and have no requirement for attendance at one of their meetings besides providing some helpful sober fellowship.

The Wharf Rats see themselves as "a group of friends sharing a common bond, providing support, information and some traction in an otherwise slippery environment."

In starting this Meetup Group, I'm hoping to have Meetups where we can gather and listen to and/or watch Grateful Dead and related music or videos in a safe and clean environment. Food, Fun and Fellowship.
results.name: East Coast Wharf Rats

results.description:
This Meetup is to bring Socionics to the people of New York City. Socionics is similar to the Myers Briggs Type Indicator, only a lot more advanced to better explain personality type and inter-type relationships.

Socionics is a personality typology developed in the 1970s and '80s by the Lithuanian researcher Dr. Aušra Augustinavičiūtė. Socionics is based on Jung's personality type theory, Freud's theory of the conscious and unconscious, and Antoni Kepinski's theory of information metabolism. Since its inception, it has been developed by a variety of Russian researchers like Gulenko. The name "socionics" is derived from the word "society", because Augustinavičiūtė believed that each personality type has a distinct purpose in society, which can be described and explained by Socionics. 

The most interesting part of Socionics is dedicated to the intertype relations research. Each personality type, according to Socionics, has a specific core relationship to each other personality type. The theory suggests that some personality types are more and the others are less psychologically compatible based on their personality differences. Socionics dating grows in popularity day by day as more people learn about this intertype relationship theory and gain valuable insights in their private and working relationships. This group is for people to learn and discuss Socionics for the purpose of self-typing and self-discovery, to find the right partner whether it is for a short or long term relationship, to improve their current social, familial, and romantic relationships, and most definitely to connect to other people who are interested in examining their lives and relationships through the Socionical lens.

With this group, you'll be able to find out your Socionics type and learn more about your strengths, values and attitudes towards the world around you, and how you interact with those of different types. 

To find out more about Socionics, check out our Introduction to Socionics.

We also have a Facebook group.

Be sure to join our wider community at World Socionics Society.

Finally PLEASE support our meetup group by pledging a pound or two per month at our Patreon page.
results.name: New York City Socionics Society

results.description:
Got an interesting problem that your engineering group has solved that:

• You're embarrassed happened in the first place?

• Wouldn't fill a 50 minute talk?

• Defies slides and all rational talk expectations?

• You can't talk about to the world, but would gladly bend the rules over beers to a few talented and like minded typists such as yourself?

Then I Got 99 Issues But This Pull Request Ain't One is for you! We get together monthly and watch a short 30 minute-ish presentation (no slides required) about an interesting or unusual engineering problem your group has tackled.

And then we drink and be merry.

Here are the group guidelines:

• Eligible companies can send a small-ish number of engineers to any one of our meetups. Try to send someone to every one, otherwise the rest of us will get lonely.

• A company becomes eligible by giving a talk, or being scheduled to give a talk. Companies should give talks roughly once a year.

• Target talks towards technical audience.

• Talk in depth. We don't need yet another "how we deploy" or "how we used Angular to..." spiel.

• Of course you're hiring. No need to mention it, and no poaching either.

We're currently collecting members and will plan out the next few months of talks. Stay tuned for the first meetup!
results.name: I Got 99 Issues But This Pull Request Ain't One

results.description: This group is for those who want to do more in life by ridding themselves of unecessary things and continue their journey by eventually becoming a minamilst. We all at some point of time have asked ourselves, why did i buy this? or why am I here? Are you guilty of waking up three times a week after beating the heck out of the alarm clock for that dead end job called a career and asking yourself as you sit in your office, Why am I here? What about that relationship? have you been asking yourself that question as well ?. That's many of us, we want to let go but just cant, we need to let go of that clutter (clothes, magazines, paper pile up, the 6 jars of jelly that have no place in your kitchen) Whatever it may be, learning to live with less especially stress will not just make you happy but will add years to your life. Join us so that we can learn from each other that it's ok to let go of your vintage Jordache jeans, well maybe not the vintage Jordache jeans, you cant find those anymore. But you dont need another pair just because their on sale and your pockets are full with store coupons. Lets become clutter free, debt free, less stressed, more involved, so we can make room for what's really important in order to live life to the fullest.

results.description:
Come practice yoga! Classes are instructed by Yoga Alliance teachers with over 500 hours of training and at least 500 hours of teaching experience. Channel your energy and power to tone your body, calm your mind, and discover your true potential!

Yoga can be expensive, so I'm hoping to create a yoga community at a more reasonable price. This will be a more accessible way to practice more often in a fun environment while getting together and getting healthy :) We're a fun bunch of a solid 5-10 regulars; newbies are always welcome!

A note on dues:

I keep the balance sheet public, so you can see this is definitely not a money-making venture - but in order to keep class rates low, we have monthly dues of $10 in addition to the class fee of $10.  We need to be sure that studio rent is covered every month, and this helps ensure your friendly yoga teacher doesn't pay out of her pocket ;) 

The going rate for yoga memberships at studios is well over $100 per month, and a drop-in class is usually about $20 - although our overhead is much lower, it still costs money to run classes. Even if you only come to class twice a month, it ends up being $15 per class - and if you come to 8, it ends up being less than $12 each! Dues can be paid online or in person, and everyone has a generous trial to decide if it's worthwhile - most of our yogis attest that it is!

See you on the mat!

ॐ
results.name: Affordable Community Yoga Classes! (North NJ)

Byte Academy is a coding bootcamp in New York City with full and part-time programs in Full Stack Python development, FinTech (financial technology), Data Sciences and MedTech (medical technology). As the first coding bootcamp with a FinTech (Finance Technology) program, Byte Academy focuses on developing industry-specific technology skills in its students. topics.name: What is Happiness: What Makes Us Happy

results.description:
Let's face it, we all want to be happy! Happiness doesn't have a sell by date or a certain framework that it fits in, we want to be happy no matter where and when. So why are so many of us chasing the elusive dream of happiness? Why are people more unhappy than ever before? 

The good news is, one of the biggest emerging sciences is the Science of Happiness. Through careful and precise uncovering of this research, and implementation of some simple tools, we can all live happy and healthy lives, everywhere, all the time. 

Our meetings include thought-provoking presentations, guided workshops, games, roundtable discussions, and more – all geared to establishing positive connection between people. Each meeting creates a unique and profound sensation that brings all participants to a lasting, positive, and elevated state.

Let's get started!
results.name: Happiness at Home and at Work

results.description:
HR Girlfriends is a networking community for women working in or providing services to the Human Resources field, who are looking for an environment to socially and professionally collaborate. The community provides a welcoming environment, promoting authentic networking amongst open minded professionals. HR Girlfriends knows no color lines and ALL women are welcome!

New to HR/Want into HR?

HR is a large career track with several options (Benefits, Recruiting, Training, etc). Navigating the landscape of HR can be daunting, but HR Girlfriends makes it easy for you. We offer a learning path for our members that will teach you core HR skills to navigate any new role, not to mention the community of Girlfriends on hand to share their inside knowledge. You'll also learn the skills necessary to land the HR job you seek. See more information below to explore membership.  

HR Pros

I have nothing left to learn, said no smart person ever! The HR Girlfriends community is a great resource for the Girlfriend who is experienced in HR, but desires career advancement. We offer training and resources to sharpen your soft and hard skills, not to mention the community of Girlfriends on hand to share their inside knowledge. Many of our trainings are certified through HRCI & SHRM. See more information below to explore membership.  

MEMBERSHIP

Joining the HR Girlfriends meetup.com group does not constitute paid membership into the community. Membership can be explored by visiting our website at www.HRGirlfriends.com. 

Social Media 

We have an active LinkedIn group that provides the support every woman in HR wants and needs. Also, check us out on Facebook and Twitter.
results.name: HR Girlfriends NYC

topics.name: Introduction to Stand Up Paddle Boarding

results.description: This group is dedicated to the beginning of VeloPaddling sport in the metro area/Lower Hudson Valley area. VeloPaddler's are dedicated to balanced participation in full body endurance cadence strokes. Equal amounts of spinning a Bicycle combined with equal amounts of Stand Up Paddling on water. Proficiency with both strokes combined into one day or work out is exhilarating and sustainable not to mention a complete full body fitness program that will delight your summer, late spring and early fall. VeloPaddler's use any bike and a light weight trailer plus an Inflatable Stand Up Paddle Board. The cycling route is planned with adequate time given for the paddling and return cycle trip. Cycling Lycra with a little additional Kayak clothing is all you need as far as clothing. A water sock or moccasin is recommended. VeloPaddling is new and we aim to be very helpful to beginners. Cyclist or Paddler or neither. Come learn and try in tiny successful fun bits. Most of all we want you to experience the full door to door round trip motor experience. We came from 11 years of USA Cycle road racing 20 years of NYC Club Rising and now 3 years of SUP paddling on all local water ways. We provide certified instruction in both activities. This is endurance sport. Hydration and nutrition same as doing 50-100 mile cycle road riding and big open water crossings apply. We can structure beginners and advanced on separate days. Fun and a successful bonk free journey is the key. Steady Eddie wins the day.
results.name: NYC Area VeloPaddling, Equal Parts  Cycling & SUP on Water

results.description: Join Life Fulfillment Coach and Affirmative Thought specialist Thomas Dunleavy, CPC at this weekly meetup for open hearted minds committed to living their best life now...one word at a time! results.description:
Open Data is a transformational trend in Open Governance that is generating empowerment and economic growth. Around the world, cities, states, and nations are publishing Open Data and creating new data supply chains and ecosystems that are managing scarce water resources, improving land use and agricultural security, enhancing transportation and traffic flows, and generating new high-tech jobs and tax revenues. Governments themselves are benefiting because published Open Data is free of organizational barriers that hold back departments from sharing information and collaborating.

This Group is designed to be interactive, informative, and fun. It will involve diverse skills and experiences, and showcase real live examples of how Open Data works, African Challenges and opportunities, and example applications. There will be online and real face to face meetups and conferences, online collaboration in global communities working to help Africa become a leader in Open Government and Open Data. Our goal is to create new global relationships that bring passionate Open Data communities together to share common challenges and build new solutions. It doesn't matter where you live, where you were born, or where you work. We are looking for Citizens of the World to work together to help African countries embrace Open Government and Open Data.
results.name: Africa Open Data

The mission of this LISTnet SIG (Special Interest Group) is to spread knowledge and understanding of SharePoint and related technologies to Long Island’s information workers, business end-users, and organizational administrators and managers.

SharePoint helps individuals and teams work better, faster, and smarter. With SharePoint, you can access the right people and information at the right time to make better decisions and get your job done. Plus, users can work comfortably and confidently in SharePoint with a familiar interface and direct connections to Microsoft Office.

Whether you are just exploring SharePoint for the first time, a business user tasked with organizing documents in SharePoint, a manager looking for a solution to a business challenge, or a seasoned site administrator, this group will allow you to network with and learn from your peers.

Welcome to the premier Hindu/Vedic group in NYC!  Join us as we together discover the oldest and richest spiritual tradition on planet earth! 

• Learn the secrets to success in all dimensions of life through applying the knowledge and meditation techniques from the original Vedic & Yogic texts!

• Enjoy regular satsangs on life solutions from the great Enlightened Spiritual Masters from the Hindu/Vedic Tradition!

• Participate in pujas, kirtans, chanting and other temple rituals to connect with the divine cosmic energy!

• Celebrate holidays and special events with fellow seekers!

Hinduism originally came from the rich Vedic tradition, established thousands of years ago. The Vedic tradition is more than a religion, it is a way of life based on enlightened consciousness! We stand out from other groups because we base our Hindu practice directly from the source - the rich Vedic tradition, today known as Sanatana Hindu Dharma - which itself is based on the original ancient Sanskrit texts of all the great enlightened Masters from the beginning of time – i.e. Shiva sutras, Brahma Sutras to Patanjali Sutras, Bhagavad-Gita as well as teachings from modern-day living Masters! 

Our Meetup is devoted to bringing together people, who want to learn about, celebrate and enjoy all the wonderful aspects of the Hindu/Vedic culture and apply it to our modern day lives! We meet Sunday afternoons in Midtown Manhattan for powerful group Vedic meditations and Saturday evenings at our base location – New York Varanasi Temple in Queens – an auspicious place housing energized deities and a Shiva lingam for weekly puja/kirtan/satsangs.  Please CLICK HERE for our Queens group.   We also hold other special events in and around NYC. Join us as we explore and share the rich Hindu/Vedic tradition together!

LaunchNJ: Women Entrepreneurs' Hub is for women entrepreneurs, professionals and everyone else interested in working towards identification of specific causes, challenges and their remediation collectively with other fellow women entrepreneurs. Join us to connect with other women entrepreneurs and share what resources work best for women.  

Vision

LaunchNJ: Women  Entrepreneurs' Hub is committed to supporting women entrepreneurs and their business endeavors by providing a safe and supportive environment to share, collaborate, connect, and mentor one another.  Launch NJ Women strives to provide access to a community of fellow women entrepreneurs as well as experts who may be able to supply insights or contacts to help you achieve your business goals. Areas of focus include: 

1.   Identifying and pitching funding sources.

2.  Building the right team to support your business growth

3.  Creating an MVP (Minimally Viable Product)

4.  Developing actionable plans to move forward LaunchNJ Women will offer structured ongoing support through a variety of means including workshops, on-line training and business coaching. 

Our work ethic and what can you do to get most out of Launch NJ: Women Entrepreneurs' Hub?

Our goal is to grow the community of women entrepreneurs in NJ. In order to achieve this goal, we want to make sure that our events and activities work for you directly and guide you now with your present needs as well as with your long term strategy. The more you participate in this group, the more you will benefit from the group. So, we want to hear from you and know about you. This will help us tailor our activities to meet your needs. Tell us about yourself by filling out the form and get started. 

This group is for women and men entrepreneurs and service providers to share and network, with a focus on women's needs.  We'll also feature speakers who can educate us on various programs for entrepreneurs in the area.

We encourage you to complete the introductory questions when you sign up. That will help us to customize our offerings to better serve you. Thanks!

results.description:
InTandem is a 501c3 not-for-profit organization that provides tandem bike riding programs to people with disabilities in the New York City area.  We conduct regular weekly rides on Saturday mornings and Thursday evenings, weather and season permitting, in Central Park and participate frequently in organized rides throughout the New York City area.  

Our members are predominantly individuals with visual or developmental disabilities.  They ride on the back of the tandem bikes. We call them stokers. Our captains, who ride the front seat, are all volunteers from the community.  InTandem pays all related program costs for our stokers and captains.  We also have non-riding volunteer opportunities – from helping at the rides, watching and walking guide dogs, and with management and growth of the organization.  

No prior tandem riding experience is necessary. However, we do ask that our volunteer captains be experienced and confident cyclists, that they be comfortable riding a bike for at least forty miles, and be comfortable riding in NYC traffic. We provide captain training and orientation prior to riding with our members.
results.name: InTandem: Tandem riding for people with disabilities

Along the road we’ll explore statistical computing and programming with software packages (such as SAS, R, Python, and others) and analytical techniques, including:
• Shared best practices in programming statistical software, such as package development (in R) or macros (in SAS)
• Training, including the latest in techniques, tips and tricks
      o For beginners only
      o Master class
• Current issues in modeling
• Providing networking opportunities to learn more about what our colleagues are doing
• Employment and professional discussions with our “recruiters in residence”: informative discussions on the state of the analytics
      o Skills in demand
      o Compensation
      o How to prep for an interview
When it comes to software we’re relatively agnostic, but want to be practical to get the job done, and will use whatever it takes.

BNI Crossroads welcomes business representatives and business owners to join in every Wednesday morning as we work to build relationships that lead to increased business through warm referrals and introductions. The group was established 10+ years ago and typically has 20-40 business professionals in attendance every week. Stop by for breakfast at the Tom Sawyer Diner in Paramus, bring a thick stack of business cards with you, and make more quality professional contacts in the local community. BNI Crossroads is a great way to get visibility for you and your business locally as it's somewhat like having a sales/marketing/mentoring/resource team! 

We are BNI-affiliated, value the philosophy of "Givers Gain", and are committed to helping one another succeed. BNI chapters are allowed to have only one profession to avoid conflict - which mean that each of our members represents a specific category of business - effectively locking out the competition. Please feel free to contact us to see if your category is currently open in our chapter! To see which categories we already have filled go to our BNI Crossroads website. 

We are actively looking for the following categories: Advertising, Air/Water Purification, Alternative Energy, Architect, Carpet Cleaner, Florist, Electrician, Contractor Carpenter, Handyman, Massage Therapist, Payroll Service, Restoration Damage and Cleanup, and Yoga Instructor.

For more information on BNI, visit their website.
