results.description:
We are exploring answers for questions such as: How do you know that the data you are looking at is the data you think you are looking at? How fast can a domain expert, but very likely a technical layperson, get understandable answers to his/her questions if there are so many ways and places where your data is stored? How you make sure that your reports will not be disrupted when you change any of the internal systems to a different kind?


Data Brewery is a knowledge sharing and sometimes lightly hacking community around data warehousing and its application. Anyone is welcome, whether you have small data or big data, whether your data is open or not, whether you are non-profit organisation or a corporation.


The topics are mostly about master data management, data quality, conceptual data modelling, metadata and ETL. We bring together data users (not necessarily with technical background) and data engineers to share their stories, ask questions and come up with solutions. 


From time-to-time we will also be talking about or lightly hacking on data warehousing libraries and applications. We are putting together a collection of open-source tools that anyone would be able to use to help them with their data problems. Language of our choice is Python.
results.name: New York Data Brewery

results.description:

Over the winter, we are forced indoors so the events will be more playgroup-centered, but as soon as nice weather arrives, we move outdoors and explore Westchester on foot!

If you know of any trails/paths that are stroller-friendly (paved) and want to put a walk on the calendar, please don't hesitate to suggest a meetup! We are always looking for new places to go. Also, the walks tend to be during the week which isn't so working-mom friendly, but if there is interest we can post walks on the weekends too!  Hope to see you at the next walk!


--Jenn and Grace

results.description:
The Empire Skate Club of New York (www.empireskate.org) is a non-profit organization of inline skaters dedicated to having fun while skating and improving the skating environment in New York. We organize social skates and get-togethers in the city, trips around the eastern seaboard and farther afield, clinics, seminars, parties and promote skate advocacy. We provide discounts at skating stores, discounted subscriptions to skating magazines, and occasionally give our members free merchandise from our sponsors. For a full list of membership benefits, visit the membership page on our website. 

Evening/Night Skates are a great way to meet people. Our Tuesday Night Skate, New York's longest running night skate, is for more experienced skaters who want to experience all the thrills of skating in and around the five boroughs at night. We also always join the Wednesday Night Skate leaving every Wednesday at 8 pm from Union Square South. This skate is for intermediate skaters who are comfortable skating in traffic (And it's a blast!!!). 

Day Skates are longer trips, usually half to a full day long, to Coney Island, CT Beaches, Westchester Trails or along the Jersey Palisades (for example), and are for intermediate level skaters. Possible day-long skates might involve hopping aboard a commuter train and heading off to a skating place in nearby Westchester, Long Island or southwestern Connecticut. Our leaders are experienced skaters who have done these routes many times. Benefit from their experience and discover places you otherwise might never have thought about reaching on skates. It's fun and easy! 

Skating Trips to other cities are weekend long trips providing the opportunity to skate, party & socialize with hundreds of our skater friends from all around the country (and beyond) in Philadelphia, Boston, Washington DC, Miami and elsewhere. Our own version of this is The Big Apple Roll (BAR), usually the first weekend of August each year. Check out photos and video at empireskate.org or bigappleroll.org.
results.name: Empire Skate Club of New York (www.empireskate.org)

results.description:
"Passion For Compassion" Benefit!  An event to support the Physicians' Committee for Responsible Medicine in the Hamptons on August 9.  Dr. Neal Barnard will be speaking, music by DJ Stretch Armstrong, catering by Suite Three Oh Six.  Silent auction items available at the event and online at:  http://www.32auctions.com/pcrmhamptons

Please visit PCRM.org to learn more about this wonderful organization that promotes an end to animal testing, more and better veg lunches in schools, education on veg diets for doctors, and veg dietary information for those with cancer and diabetes.  

PCRM Organization
Since 1985, the Physicians Committee has been influencing advancements in medicine and science. We advocate for preventive medicine, especially good nutrition, conduct clinical research, and advocate for higher ethical standards in research. Our membership includes 150,000 health care professionals and concerned citizens.

We encourage higher standards for ethics and effectiveness in research:
We oppose unethical human experiments. While great strides have been made in eliminating such experiments, problems remain. For example, children are still given synthetic growth hormone in experiments to make them taller, and both children and adults are exposed to unnecessary new drugs which have toxic effects.

We promote alternatives to animal research and animal testing. We have worked to put a stop to gruesome experiments, such as the military’s cat-shooting studies, DEA narcotics experiments, and monkey self-mutilation projects. 

We also promote nonanimal methods in medical education. Currently, more than three-quarters of all U.S. medical schools have dropped their animal labs for medical students.

The Physicians Committee has led the way for reforms of federal nutrition policies.  Our clinical research programs are breaking new ground in diabetes, cancer, and other serious conditions.  PCRM’s Cancer Project has provided vital information to tens of thousands of people.

The New Four Food Groups is the Physicians Committee's innovative proposal for a federal nutrition policy that puts a new priority on health.

Our public service announcement series features medical experts on prevention and health.

The Physicians Committee is a nonprofit 501c3 organization headquartered in Washington, D.C.
results.name: PCRM Benefit & Auction with Dr. Neal Barnard in Amagansett

results.description:
ABOUT US

HackerNest is a grassroots nonprofit organization that runs unpretentious community events and epic, meaningful, universally-acclaimed hackathons. Our mission is economic development through technological proliferation. Check us out >>> Facebook  |  Twitter  |  Wikipedia

Connecting people is awesome. And community good breeds fab karma. We cram smart, accomplished techies into a room, often with free drinks. Our relaxed, down-to-earth Tech Socials are now Canada’s largest tech meetups and growing quite quickly internationally. Our membership is diverse and highly technical. Developers, designers, engineers, social media/business folk, entrepreneurs, investors, etc. regularly gather to socialize, talk tech, hear the occasional speaker or watch a demo, and meet future co-founders, employees, funders, and friends.

Our formula: laid back atmosphere + free drinks + brilliant people = fireworks. We're not scienticians, but this seems to work. We became Canada's largest tech meetups in a year, before even leaving Toronto. Today we have "splinter cells" in multiple cities internationally. Our goal is to complement and strengthen existing nerd ecosystems – we come in peace. We hail the ideal of a strong and supportive tech community - pretty much anyone that isn't a jerk can be a part of it, so we have a strict no-douchebag policy.

Interested in running HackerNest in your city? Take a look at the FAQ. Whoa, longest description evaaar. Need to know more? Here's some answers. 

RSVP to get a custom, hand-written nametag. This is important, because people without nametags aren't even really people. There, we said it. :)


Facebook  |  Twitter  |  Wikipedia

SOME DETAILS:

********

When: Pretty darned regularly. Check back!

Format: Relaxed. Hang, talk tech, occasionally a speaker, plot to take over the world, etc.

Where: Usually in the large private office of a tech company (have a venue?)

At any given HackerNest meetup, you may find people who are:

developing incredibly snazzy Ruby (most likely on Rails) applications - heady hardcore designer types - PHP/Perl/.NET/Python/django addicts - ...Fortran devs?! - looking for a tech/entrepreneur/new business story to cover - Objective-C experts and iPhone/iPad/Apple product pundits - engineers and managers and CTOs looking for co-founders to join their angel/VC-backed tech startup - looking to write articles/stories about the obscure, interesting, hilarious hacks you've pulled off - totally oblivious and just wandered in because they heard there was booze (!?) - building a top-secret app out of their basement that's going to change the way the world does X; like "Facebook for Squirrels" - scrambling to find a partner to work with on a well-paying contract that's just a wee bit too much workload for the anticipated deadline - heroes, because they're part of the burgeoning community that will reverse all this insane brain-drain - incredibly talented, smart, entrepreneurial go-getters who are absolutely dangerous to the status quo - pretty bloody interesting, because seriously, if they're coming out for drinks ON A MONDAY (or Tuesday, or Wednesday) NIGHT... they've gotta be.

Chances are, you'll fit right in if you're a(n):

software or hardware hacker/h4ck3r (or maybe just a hack) - coder/developer/programmer/designer, UX-oriented, or just like making things pretty - biotech/electrical/computer or basically any kind of engineer - network/network/system/IT administrator - front/back-end specialist - angel investor - demon investor - venture capitalist - venture communist - tech enthusiast - tech/entrepreneur-oriented media/journalist - OCD blogger/Tweeter - bloodthirsty recruiter looking to poach developers - internet mogul - nerd/geek/freak/tweak - entrepreneur - SEO/SEM pro - writer/project manager/business analyst - 1337 individual - etc., etc.


...and aren't a douchebag. <3
results.name: HackerNest NYC Tech Socials

results.description:
New to Hoboken? Need to make new or more female friendships in the neighborhood? This is the group for that! LADIES ONLY GROUP.

• I decided to start this group because I recently moved to Hoboken and meeting new girlfriends in the area is hard to do! The mid 20s to mid 30s is also a tough stage in which it is hard to juggle in the ever important girl time because of (work, marriage, kids, etc). 

• Why mermaids you ask? Well Mermaids are creatures associated with femininity. Hoboken is near the water, it caught your attention and who wouldn't want to be called a mermaid? Haha-so it works ;) 

• Whether you are single or in a relationship, have kids or don't as long as you want to make some new female connections in Hoboken, this group is for you! 

So let's walk the waterfront, visit the food trucks on the pier, shop on Washington, laugh over cocktails and so much more!


*If for any reason you can not make it to an event after you have RSVP'd, Please update your status or send me a message. Thank you :) I understand things come up, but it is not fair to the group members attending an event to be waiting around for a member who never shows up.  So new policy is 3 no shows and you are out of the group. 

*Events are kept small, so you have the opportunity to talk and actually connect with potential friends.  I'll schedule large group events, every few months or so.

results.description:
As of July 28, 2014, The Temple of Hecate, Inc. was the first incorporated Temple dedicated to the Goddess Hecate in NYS.

The temple was founded by Directors: Laurie Bizzarro, Gary Suto, JSterling Hurley, Matthew Sawicki, Mario Pabón Andraca,  and Anna Lewis.

We are here and open to All who wish to worship, whether alone or collectively, in a sacred space devoted to Our Great Mother. While the temple, located in Staten Island by the ferry,  is under construction, we will continue to hold rituals at Catland and other venues to enable the community to gather together in worship. We Honor and welcome any and all traditions who wish to use the space and join with others in the name of Hecate.

About Our Directors:

C. LAURIE BIZZARRO

C. Laurie Bizzarro aka Lady Thalestris is a Daughter of Hecate and the High Priestess of “Enchanted Crossroads Coven and Grove.” She began practicing Wicca in 2003.  She trained with “Wiccans of the Crossroads,” and was initiated in the Crossroads tradition (Witches/Wiccans of the Crossroads) as a Third Degree High Priestess and Daughter of Hecate on May 30, 2009. She was High Priestess of “Wiccans of the Crossroads” from 2007 until she formed “Enchanted Crossroads Coven and Grove” in 2012. She has organized and lead rituals at various festivals and in the Tri-State area, including organizing and leading the current Open Monthly Hecate Rituals held at Catland in Bushwick, Brooklyn. She has lectured at the college level on the subject of Wicca and Paganism and has organized a lecture series for the same.  She is the proprietor of “The Law Office of C. Laurie Bizzarro, P.C.” representing Plaintiffs in personal injury, construction accidents and Employment Discrimination cases.

GARY SUTO

Gary Suto grew up with Hungarian/Gypsy Grandparents and was surrounded with Astrology, Palmistry, Cardomancy and Numerology. He would not consider himself a Hereditary Witch, but very close to it. He has been practicing divination for 35 years, and his skills include Tarot, Iching, Numerology, Runes and Palmistry. He is a  High Priest of Temenos Ophiuchus, a grove of the Minoan Brotherhood; High Priest in NY Coven of Witches, a coven of the Wica Tradition, initiated by Lady Rhea; Founder of NY Gay Men's Open Pagan Circle; Co-creator of NY LGBT Open Pagan Circle; Co-founder of Prometheus Rising, Queer Men's Pagan Festival; Past Instructor at the Pagan Center of NY, Psychic Reader and life coach at Magickal Realms and Catland Bookstore;  He has given workshops and led rituals at various festivals and NYC locations. Hecate came to him at one of these festivals approximately 13 years ago and has been one of his main Deities ever since. On a mundane level he is a fashion designer and graphic designer. He is putting those skills to use in creating Pagan Clothing and Jewelry as well as a Tarot deck that will incorporate the Iching.

JSTERLING HURLEY

From his early childhood JSterling had a connection to the plants and animals who inhabited the woods surrounding his parent’s farm in central Ohio. He was raised in an agnostic home with no formal spiritual guidance which allowed him to explore his own spiritual path as a young adult.

As an out gay youth he worked against homophobia and charted his way through hostile environments and helped other gay youth through violence, ignorance and hate.

JSterling is a High Priest of the Minoan Fellowship Tradition and is priest of the Minoan Brotherhood. He is a green witch and has used his knowledge of plants, aromatherapy and herbology both in his magickal and mundane life. He strives to provide a venue for the LGBT pagan community to become empowered and to reclaim their place as healers, shamans and guides of the dead.  Throughout all his training both formal and informal the constant has been the connection to his patron Goddess, Hekate. For within himself She shines through. From the wisdom of the darkness She shine light. And from the potential locked within us all she provides the key of fullness.

MARIO PABON ANDRACA

‎Mario Pabón Andraca has been a practicing pagan for over fifteen years. After being a solitary practitioner for a few years, Mario joined a Wiccan coven of the Gardnerian tradition called Polyhymnia Coven in New York City. He is now a Third Degree High Priest in this Coven.

In 2012, after his first encounter with Hekate, Mario joined Arn Draiocht Fein (ADF), and successfully completed their Dedicants' program. Currently he is pursuing ADF's Clergy Training. Currently he holds the position of Scribe in the New York City Grove "Inis Ull".

Mario has also recently joined both the Sorita D'Este's Covenant of Hekate, and Hellenion, a Greek Reconstructionis religious organization. Mario discovered Hekate in the Between the Worlds festival where she came to him and guided him to where he is today. His path is mostly Hellenic in private practice, while still teaching Wicca and leading a coven. Most recently he has been given the responsibility to lead and officiate the central Hekate rituals in the very same festival where she first came to him.

MATTHEW SAWICKI

Matthew Sawicki is a Traditional Witch and lifelong devotee of Hecate. He hails from the mountains of North Eastern Pennsylvania and learned much of his craft and magick from his upbringing there. Matthew has been initiated into three separate traditions of the craft, most notably The New York Wica Tradition where he is a 3rd Degree High Priest, The Minoan Brotherhood and the non-wiccan tradition of The Clan of Tubal Cain out of the UK, which remains his main focus and current tradition. Matthew has been a Priest of Hecate whose public rites have led people to her for over 10 years. Matthew is known for his "Rites of Crossroads" rituals at the Between the Worlds Men's Gathering in Ohio that has brought more than 80 men together in her worship. Matthew lives in New York City and looks forward to continuing his work as a priest of Hecate to those who seek her.

ANNA LEWIS

Anna Lewis, a NYC native Witch and Pagan is thrilled to be a part of the magick bringing The Temple of Hecate to light. She is a longtime friend of Lady Rhea, Magickal Realms and the NY Coven of Witches as well as Horn and Cauldron of Rhode Island. She currently lives in Rhode Island where she turns the wheel of the year with her young family, worships Yemaya in the sea by day and Hecate at the crossroads by night. She is grateful to the goddess for her many blessings and for the opportunity to aid others in their devotion.

Please join our meetup page: http://www.meetup.com/The-Temple-of-Hecate-Inc/ and facebook page https://www.facebook.com/groups/333721350124288/ (The Temple of Hecate, Inc.) for events and further information on the temple and our Directors. (website to follow-stay tuned!).

Bright Blessings to All! Hail Hecate!!!
results.name: The Temple of Hecate, Inc.

topics.name: Gongs. Tibetan singing bowls. Crystal bowls.

results.description:
The real magic is all around you, but is often taken by many for granted. Come to experience the magic of sound, the journey where people often loose their fixed ideas about who they are and come to important realizations.<br> The sound of authentic Himalayan singing bowls will help you to find your core and lead you from there deep into unconsciousness. This hypnotic sound is known for thousands of years as a perfect remedy for mental and physical healing, meditation, deep relaxation, self discovering, and creativity boost.<br> Our group meetings will help you to learn about the sound implementation in vibrational healing, relaxation, meditation, religious practices and sacred ceremonies.<br> No New Age unsupported ideas and myths, all given knowledge is based on the law of resonance, frequency follow response and brain entrainment.<br> All of my instruments were selected from the most knowledgeable experts and singing bowls collectors from Nepal. These bowls had survived trough the centuries and came from different regions to your hometown. Come and meet them.

The Korean Town (KTown) Meetup is dedicated to building real social community in Korea Town, Manhattan, New York.

IMPORTANT NOTE:  China Town and Korea Town in Manhattan have been losing a lot of local Asian businesses.  Asian Americans aren't spending their money in Asian American neighborhoods.  Become a member of the KTown Meetup and contribute to saving Korea Town.   Contribute and build what is a nice, unique community in New York.  If you don't take the time to appreciate nice things when they are there, they might go away. 


Be a force in the fun and prosperity of Korea Town!

results.description:
This is a small, select group of entrepreneurial and open-minded new or experienced small business owners who want to take their businesses to the next level in a supportive, friendly and sharing environment. 

The intention is that this group would be limited to no more than 10-15 people from a VARIETY of businesses who are committed to meeting once per month in a neutral, rotating location (Brooklyn and/or Manhattan, based on location of members) to share ideas, give honest and open feedback, share best practices, support one another, and help one another learn and grow their businesses!


I expect the meetings would be a mix of structured and unstructured discussion.  Note:  This is NOT a networking group, referrals among the group are NOT expected, and there is absolutely no pressure to share business.  The intention is to share ideas and best practices in a supportive environment!  Solicitation is prohibited, and anyone who does not respect these rules will be asked to leave the group.

results.description:
Wondering what YOU can do about climate change? Join the thousands of Citizens Climate Lobby members who are actually moving Congress toward bold climate solutions that could change everything.
CCL will change the way you think about democracy. We're not about marches and protests-- we're about you talking directly to your Senators, Congressmen and their top advisers. If you want to make real change happen, this is an incredibly effective form of advocacy. You will be amazed at how much power you have as an informed and inspired citizen.
There are lots of ways you can inform and influence your members of Congress-- through letters, emails, phone calls, newspaper articles, and through live meetings with your Congressman, Senators and their advisers. We'll teach you how to do any or all of the above-- wherever your comfort zone takes you. And we'll inspire you to maximize your effectiveness as an advocate for real climate solutions.
Best of all, we have a plan and a solid climate proposal for Congress that's actually gaining bipartisan support on Capitol Hill. It is non-partisan, politically viable, scientifically sound, and economically feasible. Economists say it is the most cost efficient approach. Scientists say it is our best shot at saving the planet.
We think New York area citizens deserve a special seat at the table when climate change is being discussed because when it comes to climate impacts and sea-level rise, they have a lot at stake. So we are focused on uniting New York area  citizens this year. We already have established local CCL chapters in Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens/Nassau, Staten Island, Long Island, Westchester, and Columbia counties in NY, as well as Albany, Buffalo, Ithaca, Red Hook, Rochester, Syracuse, and Utica, NY, in Fairfield County in Connecticut, and in Central New Jersey.
Join us for an introductory conference call or New York Area Local meeting near you!
Website info: http://www.CitizensClimateLobby.com
What does climate scientist Dr. James Hansen say about CCL?"Most impressive is the work of the Citizens Climate Lobby, a relatively new, fast-growing, nonpartisan, nonprofit group with [193] chapters across the United States and Canada. If you want to join the fight to save the planet, to save creation for your grandchildren, there is no more effective step you could take than becoming an active member of this group."
Register with Citizens' Climate Lobby to learn even more and or join us at a meetup event.

Additional information: The Price of Carbon: The Price of Carbon:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kY-ZnpWbJdw

VERY IMPORTANT NOTE: Don't let a very-low RSVP sign up number on the Meet-Up site discourage you from attending. The call is advertised in other places nation-wide. People who are already members attend local meetings and may not RSVP to the meetings listed on meetup.
results.name: New York Area Citizens' Climate Lobby

The Digital: How does all this tie in to the digital realm?

results.description:
The purpose of this meet up is to help us:

a) Sit down and write!

b) Meet (and possibly befriend) other writers in the area.

c) Gain a better understanding of the craft, its challenges, and rewards; this means discussing theory, psychology, personal experiences, maybe even books!

YOU:

You're good at writing (or so you've been told), or maybe you're a one hit wonder (that time you wrote that really good poem in middle school!). If you're bold enough to call yourself a writer, you just might be one. For some reason, however, you just can't seem to put that novel together. For some reason, your poems just...well, they don't make your blood flow the way they used to. You keep jumping medium to medium; you started with a novel about your dad's psychosis and now you've decided maybe a TV series on gentrification might be better.

You need new energy, new resolve. Just a little something to bring you to the edge and push you into the deepest depths of writer's waters...

US:

We're a group of writers, professional and amateur, based in Bushwick, who find that regularly getting together and writing while sitting with each other can be fantastically productive and motivating. Our meetings usually consist of writing for 75-90 minutes in focused bursts on whatever project each of us is working on. In between banging on the keyboards, we drink coffee and talk about our work/backgrounds/projects...if we're up for it. It's completely cool to just come, do the work, and not engage in too much chit-chat (writers do tend to be somewhat introverted).

ALL TYPES/NON-TYPES OF WRITERS WELCOME! Poets, screenwriters, novelists, short fiction scribes, non-fiction writers, memorialists, etc.   

Locations vary, but we like to gather in neighborhood coffee shops (so come ready to buy a coffee, tea, or whatever for using the space).

Bring whatever writing implements are best for your process: laptop, notebook and pen, crayola and napkins (if that's what works for you). Committed and regular attendance is highly encouraged.
results.name: Bushwick Writers Meetup

results.description:
Please note, I do offer personal training services for one on one and partner work sessions. Additionally I offer in home training services if you have a fitness facility in your apartment building or house. Contact me for details.

Hi and welcome to my meetup for outdoor personal group fitness training. This group is open to anyone who is interested in improving their fitness, losing weight, getting stronger and becoming more flexible. My classes are primarily focused on quality, not quantity meaning I'm looking for proper form and technique while using full range of motion. Each exercise circuit is timed to ensure everyone goes at their own pace. I also use progression and regression methods based on fitness levels to ensure you are getting to most out your workout. I don't like to call my class boot camp because it sounds like a hard core, going all out until you puke class. Rather, I like to call it personal group training because its intimate in size and I can give the small groups of 10 or less individualized attention. Its like having a personal trainer for a fraction of the cost!
results.name: LYFT group fitness training of White Plains

results.description:
This group is for nice people who have an interest and/or experience in Thai/kick boxing. Meetups will involve mostly: stretching, warm-ups, skipping rope, work on focus pads, and light sparring. I (the founder of this group) have very modest martial arts experience (a few years of karate, and a year of thai boxing) from many years ago. I’m starting this group in the hopes of gathering a few friendly people with varying skill levels to teach and motivate each other. To test our skills and their effectiveness. When the weather is fine, we meet in Central Park just off Central Park West and 87th Street; in the colder months, we meet at studio spaces, and locations are announced one or two days prior to each session. Join us!*

*PLEASE NOTE: This is a fun and friendly training environment. However, given the intense physical nature of our activities, injuries will occur from time to time. THE ORGANIZERS OF THIS GROUP ARE IN NO WAY RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY INJURIES THAT MIGHT OCCUR.

*RULES OF ENGAGEMENT* When sparring we adhere to the common 50%, 2/3rds strength when sparring that is common practice in many dojos and camps. If you wish to engage hard, communicate with your partner beforehand so you both are on the same page. We are here to test each other and test ourselves, learn from each other and ultimately learn about ourselves. Strength is not just how hard you can punch, but having discipline and control as well. Kob kun krab!
results.name: Manhattan Muay Thai

results.description: Are you LGBT and working the nonprofit life? Do you find yourself wishing you had more LGBT friends who shared your social justice interests, your lifestyle, your weekly challenges with funders, proposal deadlines, fundraising, networking and still managing to make a difference? What if you could build a network of LGBT friends and colleagues who work in nonprofits and live in central/south Brooklyn -- meet up one night every two weeks or so for happy hour? You brainstorm your next big idea. You pinpoint your next donor or volunteer. Another job, a career move. You meet your next BFF or fall in love with that ideologue of a partner. Or you just drink and strategize to change the world. You don't need to work in an LGBT nonprofit to join or live in central/south Brooklyn; just be willing to travel and at least be LGBT or LGBT-friendly. Join us!
results.name: LGBT Nonprofit Professionals in Brooklyn Happy Hour

results.description:
Public transit has the potential to be awesome, moving us around our city quickly and easily. But sometimes it really sucks. Buses are never on time, routes can be unfamiliar, and connections are difficult. On the other hand, taxis are too expensive, hard to find and there is no easy way to share a ride with other users.

The latest evolutions in transportation provide enough data to plan and develop new mobile apps, where no operative intervention of dispatchers (or other external agents) is required. Local companies such as Uber, Lyft or Sidecar (among other ride and car sharing, and taxi apps -Hailo, TaxiMagic, Flywheel, Blablacar, MyTaxi) are opening a window into a new relationship between cars and passengers, bringing a closer and more immediate response to a much more personalized transportation.

Let's work together to shape the future of urban mobility and use data/technology/design to make it real.

I'd like to build a community of transit nerds, developers and designers to contribute to the future of urban transportation and take it new directions so it can serve more riders in new and unexpected ways. I can't do it alone, so together let's drag public transit, paratransit and taxicab into the 21st century.
results.name: Future of Urban Transportation - NY

results.description:
Dharma Voices for Animals (DVA) is an organization of those committed both to practicing the teachings of the Buddha (the Dharma) and to speaking out when animal suffering is supported by the actions of those in Dharma communities and by the policies of Dharma centers. We want to be the voice of the animals who cannot speak our language and are unable to ask, “Why are you paying people to do this to me?” or “Why are you supporting my suffering?” We want to support those who are willing to speak out about the harm we cause other sentient beings when we eat them, use their body parts as clothing and in other ways, or use household and personal hygiene products that are tested on animals. While DVA recognizes the challenges of living in a complex, modern society, we wish to promote the choices that provide the greatest reduction of animal suffering. It is our intention to be inclusive in honoring the different views of those who sincerely intend to minimize the suffering of animals.

You are welcome to attend a variety of events when you join the DVA New York Chapter meetup.  In addition to this group we invite you to support our efforts by visiting the website:

http://dharmavoicesforanimals.org/

May all living beings be happy and free!


Our Leadership Team:

Bob Isaacson is the President of Dharma Voices for Animals.  He has practiced the Dharma for nineteen years in the Vipassana/Theravada tradition, and taught numerous classes and retreats.   Bob is also a former human rights and civil rights attorney.  He enjoys hiking, biking, swimming, and world travel.

Kamil Ghoshal is the DVA New York Chapter Leader and dedicated Eight-Precept (aṭṭha-sīla) Theravādin disciple (upāsaka) at the Original Buddhism Society.  He is an aspiring Buddhist scholar with background in Western Philosophy.  Kamil's mission outside of DVA is to help restore the original presectarian Teachings of the historical Buddha, Siddhāttha Gotama.  He is also a mountaineer and traditional Chinese kung-fu practitioner.
results.name: Dharma Voices for Animals - New York Chapter

results.description:
This group is here to connect you to other tennis players that play on a similar skill level and live close enough to get a match in, even with your busy schedule.

This is not a group for finding personal lessons or instructors, it's a group for people that are looking for a good singles or doubles match up. How this works:

1. Create or Join a Meetup: Specify if looking for doubles/singles and your skill level (see below)
2. Once you have enough people for a game, coordinate with them on time, location, and court reservations 

Your next move: Use the message board and meetup schedule to find match-ups near you!

Need your help: Please message me if you want to be able to post Meetups, and I can grant you that access.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Skill Levels:


1.0: This player is Just starting to play tennis.

1.5: Has limited experience and is still working primarily on getting the ball into play.

2.0: Has obvious stroke weaknesses but is familiar with basic positions for singles and doubles play.

2.5: Can sustain a short rally of slow pace with other players of the same ability.

3.0: Fairly consistent when hitting medium-paced shots, but is not comfortable with all strokes and lacks execution when trying for directional control, depth or power.

3.5: Has achieved improved stroke dependability with directional control on moderate shots, but still lacks depth and variety. Starting to exhibit more aggressive net play.

4.0: Has dependable strokes, including directional control and depth on both forehand and backhand sides on moderate shots, plus the ability to use lobs, overheads, approach shots and volleys with some success.

4.5: Starting to master the use of power and spins and beginning to handle pace, has sound footwork, can control depth of shots and is beginning to vary game plan according to opponents.

5.0: Has good shot anticipation and frequently has an outstanding shot or exceptional consistency around which a game may be structured.

5.5: Can vary strategies and styles of play in a competitive situation and hit dependable shots in a stress situation.

6.0: has obtained a sectional and /or national ranking.

6.5: has extensive satellite tournament experience.

7.0: makes his living from tournament prize money.


-----------------------------------------------------------------
New York City Courts:

Central Park: Central Park 93d St. near West Drive

Brian Watkins Tennis Center: East River Park, At Houston St. (walk east over FDR Drive)

Washington Market Park: Chambers St. & West St.

Hudson River Park: Near W 10th St on the Hudson River

results.description:
Do you need to refresh your math for college algebra, the GRE, the GMAT, or just for work and life? Are you going back to school after years in the working world?

I'm here to help! This group meets Sundays at 55 Broad Street (4/5 to Wall St or 2/3 to Wall St). Each 1.5 hour session includes some of the following topics:

Algebra
Word Problems
Elementary Number Theory (Odds, Evens, Primes)
Probability
Geometry
Fractions, Decimals, Repeating Decimals
Percents and Compound Interest This is not a test prep class, but would be very effective if taken concurrently with a test prep class, or prior to beginning your GRE/GMAT studies. (You may also be interested in my other Meetup groups, Unlock the GRE with Perfect Scorer Jen Dziura and Advanced ESL with Jen Dziura.)

I hope to meet you soon!

About Me: I am author, co-author, or editor of many test prep books covering math, vocabulary, grammar, logic, and more. I have developed a series of seminars on "Intellectual Performance Enhancement," covering topics from test stress to the inferential logic common to both verbal reasoning and math problems. I have perfect scores on the GRE and SAT, and a 780 on the GMAT (including perfect 51Q). More importantly, I have helped thousands of students over more than a decade of experience in the test prep world. I explain things clearly (especially to people who have "math terror"), and I'm pretty nice, if I do say so myself! I was the first person in my family to go to college, so I understand the struggles of people who are trying hard to succeed.
results.name: College Algebra / High School Math Refresher with Jen Dziura

results.description:
"NETWORKING is the single most powerful marketing tactic to accelerate and sustain success for any individual or organization!" – Adam Small 

Why do I need to network?

1. As entrepreneurs and professionals, it is imperative that we stay around like minded individuals. Relationships are the catalyst for success. 

2. In this ever so growing competitive job market, you will quickly learn that it is not always what you know, but who do you know.

3. You never know what personal connection or business deal is hidden in a little conversation. 

4. If you are seasoned, you can meet a young pup with a lot of pep to do heavy lifting for you.

5. If you are new, you can meet an expert in your field and skip a lot of mistakes just by listening to their experiences. 

What makes us different?

1.Here at the NJ Networking Circle we like to keep things fun and innovative, even for the shy and timid. What better way is there to wind down a hard work week then with a little professional party and networking. We like to consider ourselves the transition group because we are not in an up tight work atmosphere, nor is it a full blown out night at the club. You can consider it to be either the cool down of a long week or the warm up to a great weekend; the choice is yours. We just want you to take a load off and have a great time meeting great people. 

2.We will give small trainings on how to network as well as business tips.

3.Guest speakers will be booked. Usually local entrepreneurs and professionals who have success and can offer useful advice. 

4. We encourage members to make long lasting connection by helping them to find accountability partners. These are the people that will keep us on track and hold us accountable for the goals that we set.
results.name: NJ Entrepreneur and Professional Networking Circle

A small group of geologists, earth science teachers, students and hobbyists organized the SIGS in 1972 to stimulate interest in mineralogy, geology, paleontology, and the lapidary arts.  The Society has broad activities designed for everyone from beginners to professionals. These activities include illustrated presentations on a wide range of earth science topics, participation in gem and mineral shows and field trips to available collecting areas, both here and in other states. The informal social environment of the Society holds the interest of all ages from the youngest to the oldest. The general meetings are free and open to all who wish to attend. We are also affiliated with the Eastern Federation of Mineralogical and Lapidary Societies (EFMLS) and the American Federation of Mineralogical Societies (AFMS). Meetings are held on the second Friday of the month (September to June) at 7:30 P.M. in the basement meeting room adjacent to the gym and small parking lot at the back of the Father Hicks Center, St. Clare's School, Lindenwood Road entrance, Great Kills, Staten Island. At each meeting, a speaker presents a talk on their specialized field. Some are skilled hobbyists and others well-known professionals, but all of them bring their specialties to us for our enjoyment.

In order to participate in SIGS field trips, you must be a member in good standing, as our liability insurance will cover you not only to and from the field trips but to and from our meetings on Staten Island, New York as well.

topics.name: "Cloud Computing" How to use it for your business

results.description:
Today's corporate officers and IT technologists are literally deluged with marketing hype over cloud, and the economic advantages of migrating business and IT functions and applications to the cloud. 
• We have seen corporate giants like NetFlix and Sabre (global reservation system used by major airline carriers) experience cloud-based system outages, causing customer delays and significantly impacting business not just in the US, but impacted globally in the case of Sabre.
• There are hundreds of cloud providers to choose from in the market today. Not all are enterprise ready, despite their claims. And let's face it, many have paid or biased positioning in leading independent studies released by highly respected IT research companies. 
• How does a CIO or CTO, and today's CEO, tasked to identify the essential drivers of a business, navigate? Leading independent think tanks (Gartner, Aberdeen, IDC, etc) are not fully equipped to provide battle-tested and deep thorough analysis regarding the critical issues of cloud security, network throughput, reliability and ROI when it comes to enterprise grade customers. Researchers can only convey what they read and disseminate their opinions, not facts. Gartner even has in its disclaimer that all analysis is "opinion and not based on facts." 
• It's time that we get real answers and share actual experiences from companies who are using enterprise grade cloud and from true technologists that has the experience and credentials to provide an unbiased roadmap. 
• GOAL: We create leaner, more efficient companies that is secure, reliable and has the ROI to start training our current employees, and bringing jobs back to the US workforce.
results.name: New York Cloud Computing Meetup

results.description:
We, the organizers of the New York Asian writers Meetup have noticed that many of the language exchange and assistance programs in New York catering to Asians have been based in Manhattan despite that many of the attendees hail from Queens. In addition, we have noticed that most of the language assistance content has been focused on oral communication and reading of non-fiction/short articles in English.

 The organizers of this new meetup hope to bring back the meetings to the local community: Queens. In addition to English speaking and language and cultural exchange, we will also be focusing on writing--both academic and creative (pros/poetry) as well as reading fiction, non-fiction, short essays, articles, excerpts from books, and poems every two weeks. Hopefully, the readings will spark discussion about themes, concepts, ideas and issues relevant the Asia diaspora; Asian American; Pacific Islander and immigrant experience.

 Our target audience is those of Asian descent in NY (Manhattan, Queens, LI, Brooklyn, Staten Island, Bronx, and Queens). Book lovers, writers, and students are encouraged to join our meetings. Whether you are a novice writer, who needs feedback, criticism, or even proof-reading; or an accomplished writer, who would like to see how your writing will be accepted by the public and how people will be impacted by your writing; or a student working on a research paper for school; in all cases, we encourage you to submit your writing and join our meet-up group. Hopefully, these original pieces will also stimulate discussion relevant to diverse Asian communities in NY and the immigrant and international experience that is NYC.

All sorts of writing are encouraged: short stories, poems, articles or essays. There will also be opportunities for peer-to-peer proofreading and also sharing your original writings with the group. There also maybe workshops on how to advance your research skills using our American library system.

 And, finally, we hope to include events and activities that will allow our members to explore the city and get to know each other better. Events such as book readings and signings, dinners, or events at the Asian American Writers Workshop, or visits to interesting but obscure used bookstores, will be included. Our Meetups will be in warm environments like city parks or cafes in Queens. Since we are new, we may change the format as we cater to the ever changing needs of our members.

Important:

 When submitting request to join please upload a real picture of yourself - otherwise your membership will be rejected. Please join us!
results.name: New York English Language Exchange & Asian Writers Meetup

results.description:
About the Trillium Path

Consciousness

The Trillium path stems from the principles of Waking Down in Mutuality, and includes the investigation and realization of infinite Consciousness as your fundamental identity and core essence. Discovering you are free of limits, while also being in touch with them, helps pave the way for the second birth awakening where you recognize the underlying unity of Consciousness and matter. To activate this realization, our teachers offer transmission by non-verbally conveying the awakened condition from one individual to another. Transmission rapidly catalyzes your awakening, and is readily available via gazing meditation, writings, recordings, personal sessions, small group sittings or large group events. As a practitioner, you might notice shifts impacting many areas of your life in a short period of time. Within a few months to a few years, you’ll most likely achieve your second birth, and be deeply engaged in embodying that awareness throughout your life.

Embodiment

The Trillium journey helps you discover you are simultaneously infinite and finite. The embodiment dimension of our work helps you embrace infinite Consciousness throughout the full range of your unique human form, from its messy, uncomfortable aspects to its most delightful qualities. We use greenlighting, a form of profound compassion and radical acceptance, to become aware of whatever we are experiencing so that we can integrate it, and allow it to be organically transformed over time. Greenlighting relaxes the body-mind and enlivens the body’s experience of infinite Consciousness. Facing patterns and revisiting past wounds is a natural part of the awakening process. It frees energy and attention for greater levels of aliveness in the present. For support throughout the process, we recommend you turn to your teachers, mentors, and peers. Support teams can also include licensed therapists as well as other practitioners within and outside the Trillium Awakening community.

Mutuality

Mutual, conscious relating is essential to the Trillium journey. Mutuality is a relationship disposition that self and other are two aspects of singular Being. In other words, other is not really “other”; it is also you, and it is therefore impossible to harm another person without also harming yourself. Living this aspect of relatedness means having profound respect for others, listening deeply, and reflecting consciously. It also means honoring and speaking your truth while making room for others to do the same—which can be challenging. Through the practice of mutuality, you deeply explore and claim your authentic nature though vulnerable self-expression, even when it is uncomfortable. You also build capacity to perceive the tension and experience the discomfort in your differences with others. Old wounds might surface when engaging in mutuality, but, over time, the practice builds trust and facilitates deep healing and transformation. While honoring each other’s truth and existential equality in Being, mutuality simultaneously evokes respect for the functional hierarchy within our community.

 The alchemical charge and transformational field that gets activated when we come together completely without an agenda, just for the sake of itself, is moving and inspiring. Please join us.

Marble Collegiate Church has been welcoming and affirming of LGBTQ people since 1992, when a small group of gay men who were a part of the Marble community formed GIFTS. We hope you will join us in creating this world through one of our programs and activities!

results.description:
Mangia, mangia!!!! Italian cuisine is good! And is simple. Sure, some dishes are a bit complicated, but for the most part, Italian food is all about simplicity and good ingredients... and a glass of good wine... (bevi!) Join us and learn more about it! And if you already know your stuff, share it with your fellow members! I'm Italian, and I've moved here last year. In NYC you find (almost) everything you need, but it's not always convenient. Let's share ideas, and taste some food and wine!

Healthy, possibly organic, always "buono"....

results.description:

Events will be listed to provide an opportunity for RPCVs, friends and family members as well as prospective Peace Corps Volunteers to connect with each other and with international students/residents/visitors in the US for social activities and/or to take part in community development & volunteer activities.

*See www.rpcv-nj.org for more info on our statewide organization of Returned Peace Corps Volunteers.

results.description:
The goal for Black Technology Professionals BTP-NY is to create a dynamic community of like-minded African American technology professionals, innovators and enthusiasts who are working with or interested in existing, new and emerging technologies. We’re talking the whole techie gamut from bloggers, digital media specialists, community managers and web masters to web designers, social media strategists, developers, online marketing experts, recruiters, software developers, project managers, IT managers, system architects, engineers and administrators.
        And of course the doors are wide open for those folks who are simply just passionate about all things technical.
        Black Technology Professionals will meet regularly at least once a month for fun socializing and high level talks on various technology topics. We plan to feature educational meatups to learn the latest technical developments in a wide array of technologies. We also look forward to host joint events with many of the multitude of great tech groups based in New York City and beyond.
        BTP also plans to participate in local startup events and help bring together New York based developers, tech entrepreneurs and venture capitalists for possible business opportunities.
We feel this will be an excellent venue to exchange ideas and talk about technology, innovation, open source, share our knowledge and experience with one another. Tell us how technology is changing the world. Anyone interested in technology is welcome!
results.name: Black Technology Professionals - BTP NY

results.description: This group is open to everyone so we try to have a little something for everyone. Happy hours, brunches, concerts, walks, movie nights, discussions, game nights, shows, you name it. Good things are always happening at Gotham Social Happenings. See you at an event soon!

results.description:
ZogSports is a co-ed, social sports league for adults in New Jersey. This season, we are offering leagues for all skill levels in several different sports, including Touch Football, Volleyball, Soccer, and Basketball.

You can sign up as an individual, with a few friends or as an entire team. The fun does not stop on the field - we have awesome post-game happy hours after every game! ...And you're making a difference. Every team picks a charity to play for and we donate 10% of all profits to charities that YOU pick. It’s all about having fun together - being active and interactive.

We make it easy for people to get together and play with a perfect balance of good fun, good sportsmanship and an opportunity to give something back to the community.

results.description:
Welcome to the NYC House and Techno Music Meetup! The purpose of this group is to bring people together who share a common interest in underground music and culture. Many of the events we post are club gigs, after hours, warehouse parties, and the occasional day party. Anyone is welcome to join the group and meetup with us at any of the events we have posted. The goal is to create opportunities to meet others who have a passion for house, techno, and night clubbing in general. So if you’re new in town, visiting, or just want to make new friends, feel free to RSVP to an event and let us know! NYC is a top city for our kind of music and there’s always something going on. See you on the dance floor!

Disclaimer: Please do not join this group if your only purpose is to promote your club, event, self, or anything else. This group is meant to be an opportunity to meet and connect with other fans of house and techno music. All posts that are clearly promotional in nature will be deleted. 

**If you are interested in helping organize events, feel free to send me a private message.  

-Stephen
results.name: NYC House and Techno Music Meetup

results.description:
This group is for black people with a deep love of self, community and black culture. A group for people who celebrate blackness in the US, The Caribbean, Africa and the rest of Diaspora. Group is for fun social outings, not limited to but including live music, travel, cruises, festivals, educational events, dinners, etc. Love Dr. Amos Wilson? Love Maya Angelou? This group is for you. Love Malcolm X? This group is for you.
Love Geoffrey Canada? This group is for you. Love Angela Davis? This group is for you. Love Assata Shakur? This group is for you. Love natural hair and black skin? This group is for you. Most importantly, do you love yourself? This group is for you.
results.name: Black People Who Love Being Black

results.description: We may be shy, quiet, introverted, etc WHATEVER. Let's help each other break out of our shells a bit and have a great time! We'll do all sorts of fun activities around the city while sharing some drinks and laughs! Let's get out there and DO THIS!
results.name: NYC Introverts That Want To Be Extroverts

results.description:
This is about getting the best Russian spa / sauna treatments in a group of fun people. We plan to have Aromatherapy, Platza (traditional leaves massage) treatment and a lesson, salt scrub, honey mask and more.

If you are a veteran banya-goer who knows how to enjoy steam room and saunas or just want a little adventure trying something uniquely Russian right here in the heart of the city, join us for this experience. Russian baths are tricky to explore on your own (venik technique anyone?) and are best to be done in the mix of experts and neophytes. Lets meet together in one of the Russian baths, learn from each other and enjoy all the banyas have to offer.

Baths events are often associated with gay hookups. While nothing against it in general, don't get confused, this is NOT such an event.
results.name: NYC Russian Baths (Banya) sauna meetup

results.description:
Want to lean more about photography from fun, friendly, and professional photography instructors? Want to meet new people, take great photos, and have a ton of fun at the same time? New York Beginner to Advanced Photography Workshops is the group for you!

Our fun and friendly photography group offers classes for all levels of photographers - from the novice who just bought their first camera and can't find the power button, to the seasoned pro who wants to hone their skills and meet new people.   

All of our classes are organized by Remember Forever Photography and include professional instruction from our veteran photographers, and a free course workbook with notes and lessons from class. Best of all, when you sign up through Meetup, all of our classes are half off the retail price!

So grab your camera and bring some friends for a fun and memorable photo experience! We have 5 star reviews on Yelp, Tripadvisor and Travelzoo! Check out our website as well at www.rememberforever.co

Frequently Asked Questions

1.  Help! I can't find my instructor/don't know where we're meeting!

After you sign up for one of our Meetups, you should shortly receive an email from Remember Forever Photography with directions to your meeting spot and contact information for your instructor for the day.  If you don't receive an email from us, give our business office a call at 646.736.3231 and we'll be happy to put you in touch with your instructor, or send you another copy of your confirmation email. Most of our instructors also have the Meetup.com app, so you can send them a direct message as well if you need to.


2. Can I just pay you in cash when I get to class?

Unfortunately, we can't accept cash for tax purposes. Sorry! Most of our instructors can process credit cards on site, but we really appreciate it if you sign up through Meetup first so we get an accurate headcount on who's coming to class.


3. What do I do if it's raining/snowing/hurricaning on the day of my Meetup?

We'll notify everyone by email as soon as possible if we feel we need to cancel a Meetup due to the weather.  If we do need to cancel, we'll automatically reschedule you to the next available Meetup or any Meetup of your choice with equal or lower value.  Check out each individual Meetup for for more info on our refund policy. 


4. Why do you need at least two students enrolled to run a Meetup? And what happens if we don't get enough students signed up. 

Having at least two students per Meetup ensures that we cover the cost of liability insurance for our students and also ensures we can pay our awesome staff photographers a fair wage. 

If we don't have enough students to run a Meetup, we'll notify you as soon as possible and get you signed up for the next available Meetup, or any other Meetup of your choice with equal or lower value. 


5.  I don't see any other students signed up.  Does this mean my Meetup is canceled?

Maybe not! We get students signing up for our courses from several sources in addition to our Meetup group. Unless we notify you otherwise, we more than likely have enough students enrolled to run as scheduled.


Still have questions? Feel free to give us a call at 646.736.3231 or drop us an email at info@rememberforever.co
results.name: New York Beginner to Advanced Photography Workshops

results.description: This is a fun meetup group for people who really want to get better at their game. It's an open invitation from advanced beginner to intermediate advanced levels (3.5-4.5)

results.description: Do you want to walk with others? It's that simple. Join me and others. Let's walk at Gateway Park, Brooklyn. Every Saturday morning at 9:00 a.m. for one mile. We all know what we need to do, but sometimes doing the right thing with others makes it happen! I also plan to walk after work, but I am not sure of the schedule yet. Chances are it will be 5:30-6:00 or 6:00-6:30. We can also meet after walking once a week to discuss healthy eating at the brand new Applebee's Restaurant. It depends on interest

results.description:
Welcome!

The purpose of this meetup is to convene all sorts of folks that design experiences for people—from architects, to urban designers, to product designers, to web/app designers, to service designers, and more. If you create experiences for people—be they physical or digital—this meetup group is for you.

In gathering people from many different industries, I hope to facilitate the sharing of concepts, methods, and tools between members—helping us all to expand our design processes.

As we gain members, the activities of this group may shift to suit our needs, but my initial plans for meetups are as follows:

• panel discussions/presentations

• group discussions/debates

• skill/method workshops

• networking events

• mini projects/"hackathons" (think 2 hours)


Please reach out if you have specific ideas for what you'd like to get out of this group. Thanks!
results.name: Designing for People NYC

results.description:
What we do?

At Adventure Nuts we seek to change your world one adventure at a time through play and mutual learning. Together we are a tribe of passionate, knowledgeable and driven individuals who aim to inspire and support one another to develop both personally and professionally.

Why we do it?

At Adventure Nuts we believe in four core values: Learn. Share. Play. Inspire

Learn. We are all students in the life long process of learning. We ask questions to gain knowledge from one another, in order to help us better understand the world around us.

Share. As part of a tribe we contribute our expertise and engage in open conversations. Through mutual and shared respect we build the foundation of a trusting community.

Play. We let loose and embrace the unknown to enter the world of fun and play. Adult responsibilities aside, we live in the present moment.

Inspire. We are all unique and passionate adventure seekers. It is our differences that motivate and encourage us to be bold, take risks and try something new.
results.name: Adventure Nuts

results.description:
This group is about photographers and models who are from all levels of experience, who are looking to collaborate together to produce some fantastic images.  We are now expanded to MUA's and fashion designers, and hair stylists to make the creative experience a more rewarding one.  Our group will meet once to twice a month; I also run another meet-up group and want to dedicate enough time to both groups.  

The idea is our model members will participate for themed shoots; have their makeup done by our MUA's  while our photographer members will photograph them.  All parties will learn from one another, resulting in some fun diversified images.  We will try our best to match the number of photographers to each model and every model will have the opportunity to get photographed.  Our activities will be non-paying for all sides, but the experience is very rewarding.

[In cases where we do not have model members to model for us, we will have the option of recruiting outside models, which may require $20 per person.  I will do my best to keep that cost as low as possible.]

• Please post your images in a prompt manner and forward a minimum of 6 images so that our model members, and Makeup artists could keep or add to their portfolios. Photographers have one week from the date of our event to edit and process their pics to be forwarded to each model and makeup artist.  Unless otherwise specified by the Organizers, (Failure to do so, means that you aren't in compliance to our group rules which isn't fair to our models or MUA's and interferes with our exchange.  As a result you will be asked to leave our group, serious artists are required here.). 

I recommend placing watermarks on all your creative works.  Release forms will be given out to protect the creative works of the photographer and to ensure 6 images for our models and MUA's. (NO OUTSIDE RELEASE FORMS ALLOWED!!!!)

I welcome ideas for great convenient locations where we can take our photographs.   Together we can build up our portfolio's for creative growth and new possibilities.  Our past events have topped by the next, and keeping this momentum requires serious artists, and creativity. 

Disclaimer: be mindful of the risks of the weather and travels, all participation is at your own risk.   It is your responsibility to stay up to date with travel changes or delays.  But when I can I will post necessary info. as they become available. 

Our newest feature: we have a google plus community

https://plus.google.com/u/0/communities/102...

All members should to make your membership experience even better.  During off season months we continue to stay connected on our page where we share, learn, ask questions and much more.  You enter as a stranger but continue on as friends, welcome all.
results.name: New York Photo Exchange

results.description:
To visit this page directly just visit GDGNJ.org

Our meetings will always be free and open to the general public. These events will be hosted in the Newark area.

Disclaimer: GDG New Jersey is an independent group; our activities and the opinions expressed on here should in no way be linked to Google, the corporation. What is a GDG (As defined by Google)? Google Developer Groups (GDGs) are for developers who are interested in Google's developer technology; everything from the Android, App Engine, and Google Chrome platforms, to product APIs like the Maps API,YouTube API and Google Calendar API. A GDG can take many forms -- from just a few people getting together to watch our latest video, to large gatherings with demos and tech talks, to events like code sprints and hackathons. However, at the core, GDGs are focused on developers and technical content, and the core audience should be developers.
results.name: Google Developer Group - GDG Newark New Jersey

results.description:
Q:   Do you like to stay well-informed on the current events, and enjoy reading and discussing various topics for intellectual stimulation?

A:   Well, you've come to the right place!

The premise is simple: We get together each month and discuss something interesting based on what the members find compelling in a news article, video segment, or audio program.  The topics can range from the serious to the inane, but we strive to discuss something that has enriching coverage and deep analysis.  Click here to see a sample of our favorite, but non-exhaustive sources.

Our goal is to provide a friendly forum for people to come in person, sit down at a table for about two hours, and exchange views and discuss ideas over coffee or whatever beverage of their own choosing.  The organizers will keep the discussions open and moving. 

We try to keep meetup sizes relatively small to allow participation and interaction, keeping in mind what the venue will allow. Members can sign up for the waitlist if all the spots fill up. As people with RSVPs cancel, waitlisted members will be moved onto the RSVP list. Organizers will try to reasonably accommodate longstanding members who've had good past attendance as well as members who contribute by the way of an article suggestion or thoughtful comment.

How it works: Each meeting organizers select a theme and an article to go along with it. Members nominate and vote on a second article. Attending members of a meeting are expected to come prepared for discussion by having read both articles.

To encourage members to arrive early so meetings can end on time, we offer a pre-meeting topic. Usually a lighter discussion based on more immediate events. There may be an article attached, but reading of it is not required.

Join us, as we share thoughtful discussions on the topics that interest everyone!
results.name: Café News

results.description:
Hello, Are you interested in Fun Events-Day Trips? Night Trips? Social events? Casual meet-ups? Our group intends on hosting quality, organized, affordable events that will allow you to meet new people, try something different... and have fun while doing it! We are meeting in the NYC Area. In the end, it's not going to matter how many breaths you took, but how many moments took your breath away. So join Us and lets have some FUN! Hopefully see you soon,

Thanks, Robert
results.name: The Adventures of Gilligan's NYC Meetup Group

results.description:
This is a group for Progressive Muslims in their 20's or 30's looking to meet each other in NY, have light friendly conversation, socializing and connecting. We plan to meet at different venues in NYC, eat out, picnics,day trips, night outs and other adventures. We want to create a meet up for young, active and modern Muslims whether singles, couples or young families who enjoy brunching, dining, sports, outdoor adventures and some nightlife. This is not a religious,social or political discussion group. In fact we will steer clear from such topics and enjoy good company. Non Muslims who fit this profile are welcome to join us as well.  Membership is open to residents of NY, NJ and CT.

RSVP YES to events only if you are 100% committed to attending which is only fair considering there is no membership fee for this group and we do not charge event fees either.

All events are members only, guests are no longer allowed.

Please link the meet up group to an active email ID so emails and messages reach you in timely manner. This group is for ACTIVE members only. INACTIVE members will be removed from group and are welcome to re-join when they are able to participate more actively. ACTIVE members are requested to make an effort to participate in any one event at least 3 months from their date of joining and 6 months from their last event to retain their membership. Our efforts are to create a compact, dynamic group and you should have the time and inclination to attend events. 

 Actual photo must be included in your profile, membership will be declined if anything else is displayed. 

Meetup messaging is an important communication tool for this group, please ensure you are able to access and respond to messages sent by organizers. To access and reply to your messages click on the dialogue icon in top right corner with desktop view of this site or on the dialogue icon at the bottom in the meetup app. We have formed some good friendships in this group. If you want to connect with other members please join us for events. Inappropriate messages and behavior will not be tolerated and such members will be removed from group.

Organizing takes lot of time and effort and therefore we place high premium on members attending events as RSVP'd. Our organizers are offering to organize/host events in their spare time and are equally busy in their lives/careers, so we want to make this a smooth process for everyone. Request all members to note below rules of the group and take a moment before you RSVP. Treat these events as other social events where you are a guest and extend courtesy to the host/event organizer by RSVP'ing carefully. Thank you.

No need to RSVP NO if you are not attending, unless you are changing your RSVP from YES to NO.

RSVP YES to events only if you are 100% committed to attending. RSVP's will be considered FINAL 48 hrs prior to the event, last minute change allowed in certain unavoidable circumstances. Remember that waitlisted members deserve fair opportunity to attend.

Certain premium reserved events as indicated on the event write up will only have Final RSVP, in other words it will be considered no show if you change from YES to NO. 

No shows (members who RSVP YES and do not show up for the event without notice) will be removed from the group and banned from re-joining.

RSVP changes on day of event will not be tolerated with some understandable and reasonable exceptions.

Habitual RSVP changers (members who repeatedly RSVP Yes and change to NO) will be moved to waitlist by default. They may also be charged a meetup fee in advance for attending future events.

Please try to arrive on time for events and use MTA trip planner tool which is useful if you are using public transit for directions, transit changes during weekend and timings.

http://tripplanner.mta.info/mobile/

Feel free to contact with any suggestions for events that you may like to attend or host.
results.name: New York Millennial Muslims Meetup Group

results.description:
This group is dedicated to helping the solo/small business owner develop his market, brand, communication, etc. 

Have you read a book, taken a class, seen a coach, followed their advice and come up with something that seems great, but there is no way to get feedback without spending a ton of money for more coaching, more classes, etc. that you can't afford?

It happened to me a while back.  I took a great course, but the promised support and feedback wasn't there, and to get feedback and the great ideas I came up with, would have cost me hundreds or thousands of dollars.  Instead of spending all that money, I thought, I could find a group of smart people who could help each other.

If you are interested in getting some feedback for your great ideas?  If you are looking for resources and recommendations?  Join us!

We will meet regularly to brainstorm and exchange ideas how to build our business and to provide support and feedback to each other.  We will explore bringing in coaches and experts to help teach us, and when we do, we can use the Mastermind group to refine what we've learned.

I also hope we can create a great directory of people and resources that can help everyone develop their business.

                    Joel

The How:

1)we  will meet with  and celebrate those among us who have achieved great things (thought leaders, authors, educators, professionals and everyday folks) to share in their wisdom on how they've done it-and how we can too. 

2) we are creating a revolutionary mentoring system to help us bring each other along faster. 

COME JOIN THE MOVEMENT! Let's get back to being the village that loves and cares for one another!

results.description:
Welcome!

Converged Infrastructure New York City group (CINYC) is a forum for gaining awareness and exchanging ideas around practical benefits of convergence of business and technology.  Each one of us is, in some way, focused on bridging the gap between business requirements and the properly structured set of technologies to address such requirements.   We are sensitive to the dichotomy that often exists between various groups in large organizations and we are passionate about taking a collaborative approach to closing such gaps.  We are here to learn, to help each other recognize and reap rewards promised by convergence of infrastructure - a relatively new trend focused on lowering the cost of operating cloud environments by engineering and packaging technology stacks.

See: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Converged_infrastructure

We exist to help facilitate meetups where professionals & end-users can share best practices for valuing, deploying and operating CI technologies.  Professionals and experts can become aware of new market needs, and new users can gain practical knowledge, expand their foundations about market trends; everyone can grow their professional network. The collaborative cross-organizational approach to implementing CI and harnessing its benefits encourages sharing of ideas, giving rise to sharing best practices - for everyone’s benefit.

Join us if your areas of interest include business transformation, DevOps, use-cases, lessons learned as part of improved organizational re-alignment, as well as intersections of economics and technology.   We expect to have a good mix of technical and business topics and, naturally, welcome speakers and practitioners.
results.name: Converged Infrastructure NYC

results.description:
Join the Asian Real Estate Association of America (AREAA) Northern New Jersey Chapter's Meetup Group to enjoy exclusive real estate networking events, educational workshops from top industry professionals, and opportunities to promote sustainable homeownership in the Asian American communities. 

Founded in 2003, the Asian Real Estate Association of America (AREAA) is a nonprofit professional trade organization dedicated to promoting sustainable homeownership opportunities in Asian American communities by creating a powerful national voice for housing and real estate professionals that serve this dynamic market.

AREAA will accomplish this mission by:

Advocating for policy positions at the national level that will reduce homeownership barriers facing the APA community.Increasing business opportunities for mortgage and real estate professionals that serve this growing community.

AREAA’s membership represents a broad array of real estate, mortgage and housing-related professionals that serve the diverse Asian American market. AREAA is the only trade association dedicated to representing the interests of the Asian real estate market nationwide.

Membership includes housing and real estate professionals of all cultural backgrounds and is open to those who support the mission of increasing sustainable homeownership in the Asian community.

The Northern New Jersey Chapter was established in 2014 to serve the Bergen, Hudson, Essex, Morris and Passaic markets.

results.description:
Circling is the art of presence and co-discovering our deepest selves in community with each other “in the moment”.

 It’s a practice that allows you to enliven, deepen and richen conversations into experiences of profound empathy and insight. 

It’s a practice that naturally has you building skills in connecting, communication, conflict resolution and understanding others. 

It’s a practice that supports the development of genuine curiosity and appreciation for yourself and others. 

What it looks like is a group of people in a circle with their open, curious attention on one individual “getting circled”. Their intention is to “be with” and “understand” what’s happening for this individual moment by moment as “whatever is happening arises”.

The results, in my experience, are profound visceral connection and a quality of conversation that has people moved, inspired and nourished. In my experience, it also results in a much greater awareness of oneself and others. 

This is a meetup group for those interested in developing skills around or experiencing any of what they read above. 

Members can expect to learn the basics of Circling and to participate in two circles every meet up.
results.name: New York Circling Meetup Group

This group is for people of all backgrounds interested in exploring the variety of black-owned businesses that the city has to offer, through fun, casual visits that give an opportunity to browse, learn, shop, support and meet the people behind the businesses. We also visit vendor fairs that bring together online and brick-and-mortar black-owned businesses, along with dining at restaurants from across the diaspora. Occasionally, we even take in a black-created movie, performance or exhibit.  Suggestions are welcome!

Please note our No-Show policy: Please honor your “Yes” RSVPs by attending.  If you’re not able to attend, please be considerate to your fellow group members, the business owners, and me, and update your RSVP at least 1 day before the scheduled start of the meetup.  If you don’t show, or cancel your RSVP the same day of the event 3 times, you’ll be removed from the group.

Be transparent. This group requires a profile photo to join.  If you don't have a photo of yourself in your avatar, I'll ask you to upload one if you've RSVPd for a meetup, at my discretion. I and the other group members like putting a name to a face!

results.description:
An Ethics Lab is a discussion and support group that meets weekly on Wednesdays at Brooklyn Society for Ethical Culture. We are a separate entity and nobody has to join anything to work with us.

We sit around a big wooden table and we talk about what we want to change about ourselves and what we have to do to make that happen. New habits we want to cultivate. Old habits we want to let go of. Beliefs or reactions we have that are harmful to us and other people. Sometimes we discuss ethics or science or religion.

We decide on goals for ourselves and go to the Ethics Lab to report and for support.

Examples:

Mindfulness meditations. Losing weight. Finding a correct lay monastery to join. Developing your critical faculties by use of formal logic and/or mathematics. Overcoming addictions including addictions to emotions or ideas. Gaining weight. Expressing yourself through artwork. Prayer. Joining a group so you can trick yourself into reinventing yourself. Yoga. Finding a boyfriend or girlfriend. Jogging. Changing careers.

Someone pointed out that we are keeping the art of conversation alive. Yep. With a bit of Socratic method, performance art and good old fashioned magic smoke & mirrors mixed in.

Three examples of the kind of thing I might recommend to someone during a talk at the Ethics Lab.

1. Decide on the thing you want to change in yourself and then only commit to observing yourself as it is happening as the very first step.

2. Taking the time to find out what your thoughts and feelings are about your thoughts and feelings.

3. Understanding that meditating can be whatever you are doing at the moment.

An Ethics Lab is a place where people with different even opposing beliefs meet and learn that we are of value to each other because of those differences. It’s a lab because we see being wrong as an opportunity to learn.

I enjoy witnessing people deciding to change then doing it. I also enjoy telling their stories. I’m a writer so I see the Ethics Lab as a mix of everything from poetry to journalism.

I’ve learned so much from the folks who have sat at the table with me since September of last year. Every account of conscious change I can pass on makes it easier for someone, somewhere.
results.name: Ethics Lab of Brooklyn
